ResponsesInList.Title: couple of operational problems
ResponsesInList.Text: I could be a moodle maniac ... I really like the software. But I've got a couple of problems that I can't seem to figure out. 1. I login as a teacher and bring up a list of assignments. The students are sending me word documents for most of the file uploads so for each assignment, so I bring up the list of work that has been submitted. Then I open the file to look at their work. When I close the document and return to the list. I find that I'm now logged in as the student. Has anyone had this problem before? I haven't found anything like this in the fourm. Could this be some kind of session problem? 2. Students sometimes upload word documents that I cannot view. I have checked their copies of the documents and I can see them on a local workstation without a problem. I have also downloaded a copy of the file to my workstation and I cannot see it there. A file is transferred and the size of the file appears to be correct but it is almost like the file is getting damaged in some way. I found one reference to a similar problem on the forum but when I tried it, it messed up php by setting a variable in the config file that would not let you see files outside your webspace . If anyone has and recommendations for either of these problems I would be most appreciative. Carter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: couple of operational problems
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Carter, concerning your first problem, I recently had a similar problem. In my case it was a cache problem, i.e. not the newest version of the page was displayed. After checking the cache settings in my Netscape browser the problem was solved. Gisela

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: couple of operational problems
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the advice, Gisela. I looked at cache options in Netscape and found the option I think you are talking about (under advanced). I also looked at IE and found it under Temporary Internet File Settings. All my students are using IE (not my choice) and we do not have access to the browser options. So I may be looking for an alternative (smile).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: couple of operational problems
ResponsesInList.Text: Does anyone have any ideas about these problems? Thanks, Carter

ResponsesInList.Title: Weird Javascript/AJAX error appeared out of nowhere
ResponsesInList.Text: Out of the blue today, I tried signing into my Moodle site as admin, and the page loaded blank (the moodle logo was at the top, the "logged in as admin" link was visible in the top right, but all content on the page was missing). Down at the bottom left corner was the yellow error icon, which states: Message: 'xdr' is null or not an object Line: 7 Char: 1984 Code: 0 URI: http://<mymoodleserver>/moodle/lib/yui/connection/connection-min.js After mucking about on the internet for a while and not finding a concrete cause of/solution to the problem, I reverted to a snapshot I made of the server a few days ago and was able to get the main page to load when signing in, but with a caveat I will explain below. After reverting to the snapshot from a few days ago, I've tested logging in to the site with Firefox , IE8, and Google Chrome (I know it's not officially supported by Moodle, but it's my default browser). Out of the 3, IE8 is the only one that reports "Done, but with errors on page" error on the bottom, even though all the links and content appear to load. This information included in this error is the same javascript error as I listed above. Chrome and Firefox both seem to handle it fine and don't spit back any error whatsoever. The problem is that our users use both Firefox and IE , but predominantly IE, so I can't just tell them to switch browsers. A few questions: 1. What does this error mean? I'm a server admin, not a programmer. I've looked at line 7 char 1984 in that js file and nothing looks terribly wrong, but what do I know? 2. What would have caused this error to happen in the first place? 3. How do I resolve it, and keep it from happening again? Thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Student cannot see administration block
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a single student in a course who was unable to view their grades. While investigating this I realized that they are unable to see the administration block (which would usually contain the grades link), which I believe is the problem. All other students in the course are able to see the block (and thereby the grades link) and view their grades, so it appears that only this specific student is affected. I've compared her roles and permissions with those of other students in the course but they appear identical. As a temporary workaround I have given her the url of the page that the grades link in the administration block would usually direct her to (https://moodle. <our domain >.edu/grade/report/index.php?id=< id num shown at the end of the url when viewing the course>) and she appears to be able view her grades that way. I'm still stumped as to why she isn't able to see the Administration block though. Our Moodle version is: 2.6.11+ (Build 20150619)

ResponsesInList.Title: Can someone please tell me how to configure PayPal?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. I set up PayPal as my default enrolment method, and entered my fee amount. But I am not getting the 'button' that takes prospective students to PayPal so they can enroll. Someone told me I need to 'configure' paypal. Can anyone tell me how?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can someone please tell me how to configure PayPal?
ResponsesInList.Text: You may want to start here: The improved PayPal plugin . There are links to other discussions about what PayPal can do that may be valuable to what you need. Other discussions suggest a lot of options in using PayPal that you may not have considered yet. From there, you can look at the PayPal Enrolment plugin setup . Then you can go to this document: PayPal Enrolment . While this is set up for Moodle 1.8, it is valid for v1.9+ as well. There are a number of discussions in the Forums for errors that can and do occur. You can search the Forums for them, too many to mention here, but a search will find them all. You may also want to go to PayPal and set up an account, if you haven't done so already. They have a lot of information there to help you. I understand you can also use the Sandbox to establish a dummy account then test your plugins.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle and Windows Server 2012
ResponsesInList.Text: I am a network engineer in charge of a Windows 2003 server running Moodle 2.5.4. I need to upgrade my server as Microsoft is pulling support for 2003 in July 2015. Will my version of Moodle work on the Windows Server 2012 platform? Thanks for your help.   --- Craig

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and Windows Server 2012
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, Moodle runs great on Windows Server 2012. I would recommend Windows Server 2012 R2. I also recommend upgrading your Moodle installation since 2.5.x isn't supported anymore.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and Windows Server 2012
ResponsesInList.Text: the word "great" might be going a little far though. My experience has been that the same hardware running on linux can often be tuned to cope with a larger capacity than windows server. If you really have to run windows the best performance configuration I've seen so far is: Latest version of Moodle PHP 5.5 with https://docs.moodle.org/en/OPcache Then the wincache plugin with opcode cache disabled for MUC (otherwise it conflicts with built in 5.5. opcache) https://moodle.org/plugins/view/tool_wincache when you install wincache it will have opcode enabled by default - you MUST disable this otherwise it conflicts with the built-in opcode. The next step would be to modify the wincache code to work for Moodle sessions (at the moment it doesn't support this) - doing that would help to improve performance even further.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and Windows Server 2012
ResponsesInList.Text: We are running Server 2012 R2, PHP 5.6.6 with opcache enabled. We average 300-500 users logged-in at a time, no performance issues. 12 core Xeon CPU, 64 GB of RAM.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and Windows Server 2012
ResponsesInList.Text: sure - if you throw enough hardware at it you can get it to work ok, but my experience has shown that the same hardware can scale higher under linux based distributions than it can when running windows. Of course I do understand that there are cases where Windows is the only option for internal political reasons or lack of internal knowledge.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and Windows Server 2012
ResponsesInList.Text: Dan, does Memcache(d) fit in there anywhere?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and Windows Server 2012
ResponsesInList.Text: Wincache can be used instead of memcache (although I haven't done any qualitative comparisons of wincache vs memcache on a windows server.) My typical experience with people running windows as a server for Moodle is because they like all things Microsoft. Wincache is developed and supported by Microsoft and appears to work well as a MUC store. The only "problem" is that the Moodle plugin hasn't been developed (yet) to allow wincache to be used to store the session (memcache has). It wouldn't be hard to modify the existing code to add support for wincache to store the sessions. Used in conjunction with PHP 5.5 and the built in opcode with the latest Moodle code I've seen Moodle perform a lot better than some other configurations I've seen.

ResponsesInList.Title: Where would one share a command line tool ...
ResponsesInList.Text: designed to be used on server or workstation (linux/MacOSX) that 'reverse engineers' the 'files' contained in a 2 backup - ie, takes the 'files' found in the backup and 'extracts' them to a folder with their original filenames/attributes? It's a combination of linux/macosx command line utiities, bash, and php to accomplish the goal. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Where would one share a command line tool ...
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, it would be sensible to get the code into git and upload it to github. Then it is how to publicise it. There is an 'Other' category in the plugins DB. You could probably use that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Where would one share a command line tool ...
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Tim. Yes, it would be 'sensible' to use git, but decided am not yet ready for that (gaining on it, but not there yet). :|  Besides that, this is not really a Moodle plugin. So, instead (in the meantime) ... Many might be wondering ... why?  Well, have seen several postings in these forums where the poster had only a 1.9 backup and was asking how they could recover 'stuff' from it.  In 1.9 backups it was fairly easy to get the files that were used in the course.  Just un-zip the backup and in the 'files' folder there were your documents. All that changed with version 2 backups.  Now the backups use the 'new file system' ... contenthash, etc..  Situation, however, might be the same ... have only a .mbz backup of a course and need to get the files that were contained in that course.  This now requires working with an xml file and 'sluthing' the humanly recognizable file name contained in 'files' folder by hash name.  Doing this without the benefit of a database . Before going any further, the scripts are bash and php and do require a little command line utility called 'xmllint' (present on CentOS and MacOSX - or can be acquired).  The scripts are also pretty stark ... nothing but what is needed.  But, they are simple to execute and the results are, I think, on target. Offered as is .... and in the 'spirit of sharing'.  One can see a screen capture of how to use (and acquire) via: http://sos.tcea.org/moodle24/ Right on the front page : Moodle 2 Backup File Extract Scripts (swf) 5.6MB application/x-shockwave-flash Hint: when opening the above link might want to re-size it larger. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Where would one share a command line tool ...
ResponsesInList.Text: Ken, Do you still have these scripts lying around? The above links are not working.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Where would one share a command line tool ...
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorry bout that!  The domain /server those reside upon is in transition to another provider and it's been a slow struggle.   Will look around to see if I didn't archive elsewhere and provide link to (if I can find them - also had a laptop stolen which contained many of my 'home grown tools'. :\) 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Where would one share a command line tool ...
ResponsesInList.Text: Ouch! Sorry to hear of the troubles.  Thanks for digging these out. Any thought as to posting them on github or somesuch?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Where would one share a command line tool ...
ResponsesInList.Text: Don't think I'm ready for github just yet, but feel free to do so with what's provided.  Don't really care about credit. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Where would one share a command line tool ...
ResponsesInList.Text: Think I found it ... will post here.  Haven't tested these scripts recently, so if Moodle has done something different ... well, ya know what I mean. From the README.Txt file contained in the zip: Extracting files from a Moodle 2 backup ... Pre-requisties: MacOSX or Linux server with xmllint installed. Don't know if you have xmllint?  Open a terminal session and type: whereis xmllint If the response is something like this: /usr/bin/xmllint Truth in sharing ... these aren't very 'polished' but functional IF the 'stars are right'! ;) 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Departmental Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I was wondering if anyone had any advice as to how to set up some departmental pages. We have around 15 departments with about 2000 courses at our university and we need for each department to have its own department page to have general information for students and staff. All our enrollments are automatically done via our MIS and I was thinking that the best way I could do this is to have a Meta course for each department and adding all the department courses to it as child courses. Therefore all the students enrolled on any of the deparments courses will have access to the department area. Is this the best way of doing this? and if so is there an easier way to add all relevent courses to a meta course rather than searching for them and adding them one by one. Some of our departments have 300+ courses so this method will take a rather long time Thanks for any advice Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Departmental Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: Actually, I have just noticed a problem with the meta course method insofar as all of the teachers in any child courses can edit that page. They become editing teachers for the meta courses as well. I really wanted to have a meta course with all the archaeology courses as child courses and have a role called "departmental admin" that I could assign to one or two tutors so they could be in charge of the departmental meta course. It becomes more complicated. Many thanks for any advice

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Departmental Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: I think you can fix that under user policies. Check out http://docs.moodle.org/en/Metacourses , where it says: (*)Note: By default all role assignments from child courses are synchronised to meta courses. However, the "Roles that are not synchronised to metacourses" setting in Administration > Users > Permissions > User policies enables administrators to exclude particular roles.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Departmental Pages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Thanks that worked a treat, although not on meta courses that I had aready created. I had to start again Many thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Course Sections
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I've got a question regarding teaching multiple sections of the same course. I'm building out some Moodle courses (say, for example, physics 101) that will have multiple sections (e.g., a tues-thurs section and a mon-wed-fri section). I know "sections" may mean a different thing in Moodle Courses, but I'm talking about "instances" of a course. Hope that makes sense. I am trying to find a way to not have to build out the same course several times. I want each section to be a separate entity, however--they may have different teachers, and seperate forums. So, is there functionality in Moodle to do this, to create "instances" of a course? Thanks for any advice, or if my question is not clear, please let me know. Thanks, Sol

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course Sections
ResponsesInList.Text: Oh yes - it can be done and is done often; I do it myself. -if you have a department with different teachers teaching different classes. YOu need to investigate groups and groupings - have a look at this forum thread which is on a similar sort of topic.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course Sections
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm the guy who follows Mary around agreeing with her. I agree with Mary. Groups &, especially, groupings will allow you to run "sections" (in the non-Moodle sense) within one classroom. We do that for some of our courses. You can also use the backup & restore function to generate identical classrooms, which we do for courses that don't eat a lot of space (e.g., all text & no video, audio, etc.). Any time you start generating classrooms/courses, you should consider using categories. The admin and teacher views of Moodle's front page can become cluttered rather quickly, and categories such as "Fall, 2009" will help keep things tidy.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can a student remove themself from a group?
ResponsesInList.Text: If a student clicks the 'signup' link for a group can they then remove themself from the group so they can signup to another group in the same grouping ? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can a student remove themself from a group?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, usually a student can not sign up to a group or sign out from a group. However if you are using the additional module Group selection , the students can do both - sign up for a group and sign out as well (and then sign up to another group if they wish). This happens within a certain grouping if the teacher sets this so in the module setting.

I am guessing from you previous reply that this has now been added so maybe our Moodle host has an old version of the ‘Group selection’ module. I have been told we are using version 1.9.4 of Moodle. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can a student remove themself from a group?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Duncan, What you describe looks definitely like an older version of the Group selection module. The sign out function has already been implemented. However we have realized, thanks to your digging and detailed description, that there was a mix up in the download links in the module database . There is only one link now - Download for Moodle 1.9 which leads to the last and well tested version. You can ask your provider to download the right version. Thanks for the message and good luck with Group selection.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can a student remove themself from a group?

ResponsesInList.Title: Open courses in Moodle 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text: I have some courses that require the Admin to enroll students but I also have a course that I would like to be open to everybody in my company.  I don't want them to have to enroll each person. Is there a way to have at least one course that will always be available to everybody under My Courses when they log into Moodle?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Open courses in Moodle 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text: In the settings of the course, allow self enrolment, by going into the course Administration > Users > Enrolment Methods and turn on Self Enrolments, moving it to the top of the list and deactivating other methods or allow Guest Access via course Settings, and remove any password from the course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Restrict access for teachers?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have different teachers in the same course and would like to restrict their access to only those topics which they teach in the course. Is that possible? I know that I can restrict students' access, but can I do the same thing somehow with teachers? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict access for teachers?
ResponsesInList.Text: If your teachers are part of (separate) groups in your course, you should be able to restrict their access based on this. Or you could use restrict access based on a profile field (like a unique email address). However, tread lightly when stacking access restriction rules: the more you add, the harder it will be to get it right and provide access to the right people. Also, you could enrol these teachers as students in the whole course and then raise their role to teacher for specific activities (assign roles).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict access for teachers?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Joost. Those are some great ideas.

ResponsesInList.Title: Call for votes on 2 gradebook issues: Freezing Top Rows and Option to Round
ResponsesInList.Text: Please vote for the following tracker issues which the teachers in my school feel would improve the usability of the gradebook. http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-21748 GRADEBOOK - FREEZE THE TOP ROWS WHEN SCROLLING UP AND DOWN. INCLUDE RANGE ROW AT TOP AND FREEZE. Freezing the left column, i.e. column with student names, improved the usability of the gradebook grader view. Scrolling up and down is still problematic. Proposed Improvement : · Freeze the rows with the activity names and category designations to improve usability when scrolling up and down in grader view. · Put the Range row at the top under the activity names and freeze as well. It is logical to have the range for an activity visible along with the activity name. http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-21746 GRADEBOOK - PROVIDE TEACHERS WITH THE OPTION TO ROUND GRADES The MOODLE gradebook allows the teacher to specify the number of decimal points to display for each grade. According to MOODLE Docs , this setting has no effect on grade calculations, which are made with an accuracy of 5 decimal places. Some teachers choose to round. If they display grades with 0 decimal points, the number will display as if it was rounded. If grades are displayed as both real and letter, there are situations where the grade the student sees does not match what they are expecting to see. EXAMPLE: Suppose 90.0000 is set as the lower bound for an A- Suppose the 1st quarter average was calculated to be 89.5412

ResponsesInList.Title: Generate self-registration usernames
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi everybody. This is my
first post on this forum so I apologize in advance for any mistake and
specially, my English. I belong to
a Public Institution who runs a Moodle platform with around 5000 users. We have
been maintaining this server during several public managements, which unfortunately
means under quite different authentication methods for students and professors.
Nowadays are coexisting three kinds: Email-based
self-registration Manual
accounts Upload users (only allow for Administrators) The main
situation is that it is getting out of control with so many usernames. Back
then we took the decision to force the username field only with numbers and
suggest/trust the users to fill it up with their document number. But then we
started to incorporate foreign users which meant a new challenge. For example, time
to time when any member of the staff wants to upload users through the back
interface to the database some of them are not possible to create, because they
already exist (duplicated). This issue is increasing time to time. I wonder if
there is any practical way to manage this situation. So far I can only think in
one option: external link self-registration and then auto generated the
username and send the whole accesses through e-mail. The problem with this
option is that we don’t have a specialized programmer and I guess are necessary
some skills. What about an external server? However, if this is the only way we’ll
have to do it. In conclusion, we want to keep the authentication methods mentioned above and settle a kind of pattern for new usernames. We can handle the " Upload users" part, but we can not control what happens every time a new users wants to self-register in our Moodle. Any link,
suggestion, documentation is more than welcome. I've searched on the Internet about this situation but I couldn't find anything so far. Thanks in
advance. Greetings, 4lifetime

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Generate self-registration usernames
ResponsesInList.Text: Mar Cooch may be the best person to know about this. I thought there was an option like "If the username exists then add a number" like sallyfield becomes sallyfield2. We had the same problem for a while, and it exists everytime you have you have roll your on and upload by CSV in the same system. A really simple code fix You could add an odd letter combination whenever you uploaded usernames.  Like maybe all with usr as the first three letters.  All you need then is a tiny code fix to not ever allow anyone to self create with usr.  Then you know that all the usr names are yours. I am not advocating this.  Having core hacks is not the best. -Derek

ResponsesInList.Title: Upload users via csv - use with SSO LDAP
ResponsesInList.Text: I've tried to find an answer but to no avail. I'm wondering, can I use the bulk upload user function in combination with LDAP ? This is what I want to do: Students will be logging on using LDAP, however I want to put them into courses. I plan to upload a csv file with the students' courses etc included in it. If I use the "update existing users" in the bulk upload will that be OK or will there be a problem with LDAP? Thank you in advance for any information. Kind regards, Eric

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload users via csv - use with SSO LDAP
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Eric, if user accounts already exist in Moodle and are bound with LDAP auth, if you update users via csv to manually enroll them into courses, provided you do not update users auth everything should work. However you can always test the procedure with a couple of users before massively update all users. As an alternative, If you are using LDAP you could check LDAP enrollments, which allows you to enroll users into Moodle courses regardless their account is already mapped or not into Moodle: http://docs.moodle.org/26/en/LDAP_authentication .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload users via csv - use with SSO LDAP
ResponsesInList.Text: oops, I provided the wrong link, sorry for the confusion: http://docs.moodle.org/26/en/LDAP_enrolment

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload users via csv - use with SSO LDAP
ResponsesInList.Text: Eric, I am overly cautious and add a column for auth and then put ldap in each row so it doesn't change all of the accounts to manual which I somehow managed to do with hundreds of users a few years ago.  I test it with one or two students before I batch upload.  It is easier to fix 1-2 than hundreds. Barbara

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload users via csv - use with SSO LDAP
ResponsesInList.Text: Eric, yes, using the "auth" column header in your CSV file, you can then add the "ldap" value for every user contained in the file.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can i Lock a topic for required days
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello , I am new to moodle, I have read user guides and set up a basic moodle course site(version 1.9.8). I have arranged the course in topics format. If i have 5 topics i want that for every new student topic 2 should unlock after 15 days and hence forth for other topics as well in the same order Is this kind of setting possible in current version ? will this kind of functionality be available in moodle 2.x versions ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can i Lock a topic for required days
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately there is no "time release" of topics based on when a user registers for a course. So there is no "userA registered on May 1st, so open topic 2 for userA on May 16th (i.e. 15 days later); userB registered on May 3rd, so open topic2 for userB on May 18th (i.e. 15 days later)" functionality. About the only thing you can control is the overall "release date", so you could set each individual activity/resource in a new topic to be released on "May 24th at 11:55pm" for everyone in the course. If you set it up this way, all students will be able to see the links to the activities /resources, but when they click on them, they will be presented with a screen that says, "This activity/resource is not available yet," until May 24th at 11:55pm. Not sure if this functionality is coming in 2.0, but I doubt it. On the other hand, you might find that Conditional Activities (core in 2.0; hack in 1.9) provide the functionality you want. Topics would become available based on completion of previous Topics.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can i Lock a topic for required days

ResponsesInList.Title: Control of Blocks in 2.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am not sure if this is the right place to ask - but here goes anyway. I have just upgraded from 1.9.10 to 2.0 and it looks great. I have installed a number of themes. Some of these themes have placed on the right blocks that are normally on the left, e.g. navigation, settings etc. I am thinking particularly of themes such as simplespace and creatif. I cannot seem to find a way of shifting these blocks back to the left in a simple way. Are the positions of these blocks hard-wired in the  themes or are am I missing something? Thanks for any help Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Control of Blocks in 2.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andrew, In Moodle 2.0 there are no longer the two hard-coded block regions, now themes are able to choose what block regions they want to make available. In the case of themes where there all the block are on the right that is because they have chosen to only use one block region, which of course means you won't be able to move the blocks to any other place. Unfortunately there is no quick fix to introduce additional block regions, if you want to you will have to either copy or extend the theme you want to use and then edit the layout files and CSS to introduce the new block regions. If this is a path you want to go down I strongly suggest reading http://docs.moodle.org/en/Development:Themes_2.0 and the other doc pages that are listed under `See also`. The themes forum is also very active if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask there. Hope that helps in some way. Cheers Sam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Control of Blocks in 2.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Sam. That's very helpful. I think I will find a theme I can live with and stay with it for a while - maybe one day I will be able to work on this. Now for one more question... In the old themes I used to be able to hide blocks from various users. Now, in 2.0 there is one block I simply do not know how to get rid of: the "navigation" block which a[[ears to be common to all themes (that I can remember). Any hints on what I should do to make it invisible to non-admin users? Thanks Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Control of Blocks in 2.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andrew,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Control of Blocks in 2.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Sam. Cheers Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How and where do i change the MYSQL password?
ResponsesInList.Text: Sounds like you have an existing installation and need to change the pw on your existing db and in Moodle, right? Someone else here has more experience regarding Moodle, but the first thing I would do is a local text search of all moodle files for the old pw. It might be encrypted.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How and where do i change the MYSQL password?
ResponsesInList.Text: you are exactly correct.  i have existing moodle and DB.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How and where do i change the MYSQL password?
ResponsesInList.Text: You say your using windows, are you using EasyPHP or IIS for your web server? You will need to edit the config.php file in the root of where you have moodle installed. If you are using EasyPHP then do the following. If you are not using EasyPHP then you may be able to do this by just typeing the command at the prompt without going to the Mysql directory. Bring up a command prompt. Next navigate to where you installed EasyPHP and Moodle. The default is C:\EasyPHP. CD C:\EasyPhp\myql\bin mysqladmin -h localhost -u root -p password your new password You will be asked for your original password and then it will change it to the new, desired password. Note the password at this point is blank so just hit enter when it asks for your current password. Once you have changed the password for MySql you will need to bring up a text editor. I recommend Notepad. Open the file C:\EasyPHP\www\Config.php and where you see this line. $CFG->dbpass = ''; Place you new password between the single quotes. Example: $CFG->dbpass = 'Your New Password'; Save the file.

ResponsesInList.Title: Students not able to access course
ResponsesInList.Text: I set up the course with an enrollment key. I then asked students to setup a new account. They were then sent an email for confirmation. Some were able to confirm, and some were not (for various non-moodle reasons). I manually confirmed them in the Administrator mode. These students are not able to access any course material. For example, they can log in but the screen returns to the basic login screen without any option to select a course. On some students' machines, they are able to select their course from a list of courses when they click on their "logged in name" and then go to their own screen. The bottom line, most of the kids can log in, but the interface does not change or allow them to select a course. Ideas? Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students not able to access course
ResponsesInList.Text: After you manually confirmed them, did you enrol them in courses ? As the course is setup with an enrollment key, you will have to manually enrol them into the courses as students.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students not able to access course
ResponsesInList.Text: Or provide them with the enrollment key.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students not able to access course
ResponsesInList.Text: It is not these things, more likely it is a sessions problem. If you are not getting any options to select courses, check that all sessions have closed properly. It is a little unusual to get anything at all, but my guess is still sessions. Use FTP , or other, and go to moodledata/sessions folder, delete everything there. It will not negatively impact on the Moodle. Tell everyone to empty their cache too - dump their Moodle cookies as well, if they know how to, if they do not then it should not be too much of a problem, but with PHP overkill in cleanups is often better than insufficient.

ResponsesInList.Title: Packaging courses together
ResponsesInList.Text: It's going to be difficult to explain, so bear with me. And I'm pretty sure there's NOT a way to do this, I just want to confirm. Basically what I need is a way to create customized course packages. I've already determined that using the meta course link option won't work for what I have in mind because I have courses that I need to be within packages but also stand alone. My courses are not one time things, and they don't end, so they are open forever, for students to revisit and enjoy whenever they like....refresh their memories or go back and do activities they missed their first time around, that sort of thing. They are a lot of fun. For kids. So what I am doing is offering packages with groups of courses, but I'm also offering some of the courses separately. So the problem is that I cannot just meta course link them together because if I do that then if a person buys a stand alone class that is from that package separately, then they end up getting the linked courses too. If this is true...and there's no plugin or other way to package classes in another way, then I suppose I'll just have to give families a bunch of enrollment keys so they can get the stand alone courses when they buy the appropriate packages that includes them. But I had hoped to make it easier for them then that. I just need to be able to have these specific courses be able to be offered as individual courses AND also included in packages....because some people will want the package, and some will just want certain courses individually. Is there any way to do that short of just giving them a whole list of enrollment keys and making them have to manually enroll themselves?

ResponsesInList.Title: Google Cloud App Engine (Not Google Compute Engine) and Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, With google cloud there are 3 different possibilities - compute engine, container engine and App engine. I understand that Moodle works well with compute engine. Please let me know if there is a version that works with App engine or container engine. These are interesting because they are "little more cloud" and will be cheaper.  I think it needs to be threadsafe and re-entrant so that it can be scalled by app engine. Any idea if there is a plan for such Moodle version?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Google Cloud App Engine (Not Google Compute Engine) and Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle is *just* a PHP application so is not thread-safe or otherwise... Is PHP thread safe? I believe there is some dispute over that. Anyway... it seems to be problematic running Moodle on these systems: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/google-appengine/T4jYr1tz8SY

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Google Cloud App Engine (Not Google Compute Engine) and Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks a lot. It helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Google Cloud App Engine (Not Google Compute Engine) and Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Don't think Moodle will ever package 'specials' - 'one size fits all' appears to be the approach with what is provided for download .   Then again, maybe Google isn't the best place to host .   Maybe Amazon is (right now, cause they have been at it a lot longer than Google .... even though Google is catching up) I have a Google Compute Engine instance.  One of the things (there is more than one) that would prevent most from venturing into Google is billing (how much it cost) and use of services Google offers - like Google SQL .   An expensive venture into using a GCE CentOS 7 instance (which doesn't have the App Engine restrictions) using Google's SQL led to a rather large monthly bill ... just one time.  The expense was in using Google's SQL - due to the nature of Moodle being dynamic and using DB all day/every day/all day long. Single GCE instance, however, isn't as scalable as someone described in these forums as it is on Amazon. Of course, one can always find a blog : http://yiannakasgeorge.com/2015/06/22/how-to-autoscale-moodle-lms-on-amazon-web-services/ Much to cuss/discuss ... and due to 'cloud wars', it is a moving target right now. But, don't let that discourage you from pursuing ... do pursue ... and please come back to share your experiences. IMHO , one of these days Moodle Forums might include forums especially for Amazon Hosted, Google Hosted, Azure Hosted, etc. Wonder how many Moodle Partners actually host with Amazon (other) right now? ;) 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Error reading from database when applying filter on user list
ResponsesInList.Text:
I am receiving the following error when I apply a filter to the 'Browse list of users' under Site Admin > Users.  We are running Windows Server 2012r2 with MSSQL on IIS8.  Any suggestions would be truly appreciated! × Debug info: SQL State: 42000
Error Code: 448
Message: [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 11 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Invalid collation 'utf8mb4_unicode_ci'.
SELECT id, username, email, city, country, lastaccess, confirmed, mnethostid, suspended , firstnamephonetic,lastnamephonetic,middlename,alternatename,firstname,lastname FROM mdl_user WHERE deleted <> 1 AND id <> '1' AND username COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci LIKE N'%c%' ESCAPE '\' ORDER BY firstname ASC OFFSET 0 ROWS FETCH NEXT 30 ROWS ONLY [array ( 0 => '1', 1 => '%c%', )] × Stack trace: line 486 of \lib\dml\moodle_database.php: dml_read_exception thrown line 324 of \lib\dml\sqlsrv_native_moodle_database.php: call to moodle_database->query_end() line 431 of \lib\dml\sqlsrv_native_moodle_database.php: call to sqlsrv_native_moodle_database->query_end() line 896 of \lib\dml\sqlsrv_native_moodle_database.php: call to sqlsrv_native_moodle_database->do_query() line 972 of \lib\dml\sqlsrv_native_moodle_database.php: call to sqlsrv_native_moodle_database->get_recordset_sql() line 525 of \lib\datalib.php: call to sqlsrv_native_moodle_database->get_records_sql() line 228 of \admin\user.php: call to get_users_listing()

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error reading from database when applying filter on user list
ResponsesInList.Text: I found the issue with this from a post I found on this forum. In config.php, in the Database Setup section, there is a collation setting that reads thus (emphasis added): 'dbcollation' => 'utf8mb4_unicode_ci', // MySQL has partial and full UTF-8 // support. If you wish to use partial UTF-8 // (three bytes) then set this option to // 'utf8_unicode_ci', otherwise this option // can be removed for MySQL (by default it will // use 'utf8mb4_unicode_ci'. This option should // be removed for all other databases. I commented this out of the config.php file then restarted my IIS site and I was able to run a filter from the user list.

ResponsesInList.Title: Course display
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, I am a new moodle user/admin , just learning as i go , so forgive me if i question is silly . I am currently running a windows server with Moodle 2.7.14. xxamp I like to display the short name of the course under the Course categories instead of the full name of the course. I cant find what .ini file to do this in .    Could some one please help me .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course display
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, you won't find that in any .ini file. The architecture of Moodle is PHP so if you understand how PHP is structured then you will have a good chance of finding the string of code that generates the course name on the Category page. As a general observation, the reason the full name of a course is printed to the Category is that as the Moodle gets larger, and there are more courses available, Users need specific identification of courses when navigating blind. Often, it is only the Dashboard that is used in larger Moodle, which essentially does away with using Category pages as part of the navigation through the Moodle. The Dashoboard only shows those courses the User is enrolled in.

ResponsesInList.Title: Learning standards: Cartridge Creation & Support Between Versions
ResponsesInList.Text: I work for a higher learning publisher and we sometimes get requests from universities to supply a cartridge in Moodle. One particular university is currently using Ver. 1.9.2 but has plans to upgrade later this summer. My developers have asked me what version of Moodle they need to produce this cartridge for, and because they're not sure what version they will be upgrading to, I don't really have an answer for them yet. Are there any isses with backwards compatible support for cartridges in the newest version of Moodle? I've heard that 2.0 will be realeased shortly. Will there be issues with backwards compatibility with 2.0? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Learning standards: Cartridge Creation & Support Between Versions
ResponsesInList.Text: It depends what you mean by 'cartridge'. Moodle has supported the SCORM standard for learning objects (horrible phrase) for some time, and fairly recently, I think about Moodle 1.9.3, a lot of bugs were fixed, and we now pass the SCORM 1.2 test suite, although we are not certified (yet). If SCORM is not enough then there are a couple of optoins If you are interested in formatting your content so that it can be imported into Moodle as native Moodle content, then you should write files to the Moodle backup format. That is not documented in detail anywhere, but it is basically a zip file containing moodle. xml and files. We strive to keep that backwards compatible, (so if you make a backup from Moodle 1.6, it should restore into Moodle 1.9, for example).

ResponsesInList.Title: IMP - Algebra Filter Working on Windows Machine
ResponsesInList.Text:
Dear Frnds, After a long research on "How to get work Algebra Filter on Windows ?" Solution was founded as Below : The Error appeared was : Undetermined Error and when the page loads for @@x^2@@ it shows algebra2tex.pl file also Steps for Solution Download Perl setup for windows using following link http://downloads.activestate.com/ActivePerl/Windows/5.6/ActivePerl-5.6.1.633-MSWin32-x86.msi Run the setup (Just run normally without any changes)
After that go to directory where the perl is install
it must look like "C:/Perl/bin/perl.exe" copy the path open the algebra2tex.pl file from "moodle/filter/algebra/" directory
and edit the first line #! /usr/bin/perl to #! "C:/Perl/bin/perl.exe" Save the file Restart the windows if you get any problem Note that if any other problem occurs than check that apache is supporting mod_cgi module and also .pl cgi-script in httpd.conf file

ResponsesInList.Title: how to add code to create ppt
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I want to know how to add code to create content with moodle as platform. Plz help... I want to add code so that teacher 'll b able create their own content material at any moment. Sudha

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to add code to create ppt
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm not sure what you mean. Do you mean you want Moodle material to be exported as a PowerPoint?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to add code to create ppt
ResponsesInList.Text: I think what you are asking, is why can't our teacher create a new course, or add content to a course you created? If this is the question, their permissions may be set wrong. Possibly they are a non-edititing teacher in the course, instead of an editing teacher. To allow them to add content to a category (including new courses) you need to be logged in as an administrator, click on the course category, then add them as a teacher. If you in the course iteself when you assign their role, it only affects tha one course, and everywhere else they remain the default role, which is "authenticated user". Assigning them at the category level can bite you later if you need to transfer a course from one category to another (an english 101 class goes from category "English" to category "Beginning English" for example.) The teacher role has permissions in the "English category" but not in the "Beginning English" category. (You only tranferred the class itself.) Hope this helps, as this is one of the hardest concepts to understand and keep track of in Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to add code to create ppt

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to add code to create ppt
ResponsesInList.Text: Teacher should be able to operate / download PPt/word from my interface . If you upload a file using the "Link to a file or resource" option in the "add a resource" menu anyone accessing your site will be able to download the PPT or any other file. Teacher should be able to download & incorporate videos & audios directly from my interface. If you embed videos or audio then anyone accessing your site will be able to see the video. If you want them to download them, then using the above option might be better. Teacher should be able to capture the actions and run it for the students -I can use this to build a tutorial for my system There are other programs that do this: captivate and camtasia are two of the best though quicktime in Apple's snow leopard system can also do it. Buiding a tutorial for using my system Use the aforementioned software or do a search on Youtube for tutorials on how to use moodle.

Any LP that includes course management in school will probably need to be able to automatically update it's tracking and assemnet tables with these vocabularies. Is there anywhere in Moodle where you can track coverage of a programme of study against authoritative vocabularies? All I can think of is the scales section? Some helpful links are:- http://www.becta.org.uk/corporate/publications/documents/Becta_view-quality.pdf http://www.curriculumonline.gov.uk/SupplierCentre/Metadataguides.htm BTW Becta are currently advertising a related job. http://vacancies.becta.org.uk/content/current_vacancies/vacancies/9331_project_manager_lss/job_description.htm

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle - GoDaddy 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text: First - I don't use GoDaddy so don't take my word for anything. However, I have used other shared hosts in the past and they don't always allow users access to php.ini so if you can't it, it is possible it is not available for you to find, and you would have to ask them. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle - GoDaddy 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi: On GoDaddy linux platform, the commands in php.ini file you write and set in your root directory overrides the GoDaddy php.ini itself. So, create a php.ini file containing only the commands for setting upload file size limits. But it is necessary, also, to set a temp dir for storing uploaded files while the loading process is on. Good luck.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle - GoDaddy 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text: First, Hi Mary and I hope your having a good day. Now, to the issue.  G-Daddy is one of the most secure virtual providers in the industry.  It is really hard to adjust anything with them. Most of what I will tell you is relative to what type of hosting you have with them.  If you have access to cPanel then you can go to your root directory and you will see php.ini there.  If on the other hand you are on shared hosting, you will need to put a php.ini file in your /<Moodle>/ directory.  So if you can give us a little more info it will make it much easier to help you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle - GoDaddy 1.9

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle - GoDaddy 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Stefan, I have a GoDaddy hosted server (and also a VPS). I created a simple php.ini file containing upload_max_filesize (see attachment).  I was able to move this into either my root area on GoDaddy, or my public_html folder.  In either case, this changed the php value. You should be able to test this yourself by temporarily moving the info.php file to your web root (public_html), and then putting the URL www.yourdomain/info.php into your browser.  Do this before and after the changes, and you should see the new values shown.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle - GoDaddy 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Stefan, thanks for this information. First, I see that you probably purchased the GoDaddy Economy VPS.  The 1GB of RAM might cause problems.  I have a Value VPS, and when I check, I have only 800MB of the 2000MB free, so my "simple" install is needing 1.2GB.  Having said this, maybe you will be okay.  I have just always purchased the "Value" VPS, which has 2GB of RAM. Here is what I have running on my VPS: PHP Version 5.5.7, MySQL 5.5.34, CENTOS 6.4, Apache 2.2.26.  The VPS comes with a basic configuration, but you can bump up the versions of PHP and MySQL yourself.  Not know what else you might be doing with your VPS, you have to be careful of versions of all of these things.  I am just running my website and Moodle, so my configuration is running fine. If you want to explore a little, from WHM, go into "EasyApache".  This is where you can modify your system "easily".  You should see that you can change the version of PHP, mySQL, and many other things.  Eventually, you will need to add a few features for Moodle using EasyApache, so exploring will be beneficial. Remember, if you mess up your VPS, you can simply "reprovision", and this puts you right back to ground zero. I find this to be a really great feature, and I do mess things up (on my experimental VPS). As you have probably learned, one disadvantage of a GoDaddy VPS is that you are expected to do many things on your own.  I have learned much on my own over the last 4 years, and some other guidance that you are getting is based upon what others have learned.  Often, there are more than one way to do things, so you will probably have to digest everyone's input yourself. I want to tell you, however, that this GoDaddy VPS really does work!  I teach around 15 courses a year, about 300 students a year, all on my own install of Moodle.  I can easily upgrade, and the GoDaddy system is very solid.  Some folks don't prefer (like) GoDaddy, but I am one who believes that with size (GoDaddy might now be the largest server company), comes some knowledge (they seem to know how to set up these VPSs), which delivers some comfort to me. It might be fine for you to experiment with the basic Economy VPS, you might not be able to run "Opcache", but Moodle will still work for you. Keep asking for help, and people will try to help.  I was swamped with my online courses over the last week, and traveling, but for the next 5 days I will be watching for your posts.  Let us know if you decide to upgrade to the Value VPS.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle - GoDaddy 1.9

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle - GoDaddy 1.9

Quite honestly, if you do the move yourself you would learn a lot more, and you would know what you had done so that you can repeat it, if necessary.  But I understand your situation. On my production VPS, I am still running a copy of Moodle 1.9 (upgraded, of course).  When I went to Moodle 2.0, I started from scratch.  But I preserved all of my Moodle 1.9 files so that I could get back to historical course data.  What I find interesting is that Moodle 1.9 runs just fine on my upgraded VPS. If you happen to buy a new Value VPS, you can install the new Moodle on it.  I would suggest the latest Moodle, 2.6.2+.  Then, eventually, you can move your old Moodle to this VPS.  I think you said you were willing to start from scratch with Moodle 2, but my memory can be wrong. Incidentally, on your VPS, you can have many installs of Moodle.  For example, www.yourdomain.com/moodle , www.yourdomain.com/moodle19 , www.yourdomain.com/moodle-experiment , and so forth.  Then, when you want to experiment and not disturb your "production" moodle, you can.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What file types are required
ResponsesInList.Text: That is a little weird, but when you say "cloud" do you mean you are new to the MoodleCloud or to the Forums? Are you using a Moodle you have built for yourself or the Moodle created online for free? In either case, PDF files are a mainstream file type so should be able to be uploaded with no fuss. If you are talking about MoodleCloud, then as long as the file is less that 200MB in size it should upload without an issue. I don't think that the MoodleCloud restricts PDF's in any way. For your own Moodle, the filesize is restricted by several factors, the upload limit of the server , the upload limit of the PHP server, the site upload limit of the Moodle and the course upload limit of each course (if it is lower than the site upload limit).  That, however, should not throw a non-recognized file type error.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to mimic moodle's org site?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello: I am thinking of a moodle site that is organized similar to the moodle.org's, meaning that I'd like to have a plain page with several menus that lead to other pages - all introductory or informative and that do not requite login. More specifically, I would like to provide as much information as possible for free and offer a login only to perform exercises. How did moodle do it? Thank you, Alex

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to mimic moodle's org site?
ResponsesInList.Text: A lot of the cool stuff is done with themes. However you can have your front page be open. set your site to auto login guests (Administration Block->Permissions->User Policies) Then people will see your front page when they go to your url Then go to Administration Block->Front Page->Front Page Settings and make sure you are displaying a topic section. In that topic section add a label. In that label add some pictures for your buttons and hyperlink them to parts of your site (probably other courses) Make sure each course that you have open allows guests in without the key (one of the last options Course Administration Block->Settings)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to mimic moodle's org site?
ResponsesInList.Text: Colin, sincerest thanks for your time and advice. Alex

ResponsesInList.Title: Audio playing multiple times in Atto
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, if you place an audio file inside a page and the start editing this page in Atto, the sound file will play, and with every change/autosave, a new instance of the file will start playing. You quickly end up with 5 or more times the same audio file that plays in a cacophony. While this isn't really a problem for the learners, it is very annoying to edit a course. Especially if you want to summarize your recording in the text you're editing... Here's a small video demonstrating the issue: So I wanted to report this on Moodle Tracker , but I wasn't allowed to post the issue to the tracker.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Audio playing multiple times in Atto
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jurgen, Have you unchecked the autoplay checkbox under Add Media > Audio > Advanced settings? If you disable the autoplay, the file shouldn't start playing every time you save or autosave the page. As for adding things to the tracker, be sure to vote/follow a handful of relevant tickets/issues there to show you're actually a human being, before you add your own. This is to prevent bots from spamming the tracker system.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Audio playing multiple times in Atto
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joost, No, I have not unchecked the autoplay checkbox. I want the audio to automatically start playing when I view the page. I don't want the audio to play while I'm editing the page. And if it really has to play, not to have it play a new instance of the sound with every autosave, causing it to play the clip 10 times with a half second delay in between each instance. Just have a listen to my video clip, going on from second 56... sorry I forgot to record my desktop audio so it's a little quieter than I had anticipated. Oh, and thanks for the feedback on the tracker. I guess I'll have to follow a few bugs that I'm not really interested in to allow me to post a bug.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Audio playing multiple times in Atto
ResponsesInList.Text: It might be easier then to leave the audio as Click to play (autoplay off) until you finish editing the page or resource. Then, at the end, set audio to autoplay. That way, when autosaving your progress, Moodle shouldn't start playing the audio file over and over again.

ResponsesInList.Title: when teacher's email is yahoo - all emails won't be send
ResponsesInList.Text: A very weird situation started to happened, everything was just fine, untill today when teachers who has yahoo domain email and try to send message in "news forum" the student won't get the emails only the admin will get error emails about the message. when a teacher is not with yahoo domain everything works fine and the message is sent properly . please help us if you can these are the error messages that the admin get: A message from the teacher: yyy.ac.il< xxxx@yahoo.com >: 98.138.112.33 failed after I sent the message. Remote host said: 554 5.7.9 Message not accepted for policy reasons.  See http://postmaster.yahoo.com/errors/postmaster-28.html STARTTLS proto=TLSv1; cipher=DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA; subject=/C=US/ST=CA/L=Sunnyvale/O=Yahoo! Inc./CN=*.yahoodns.net; issuer=/C=US/O=DigiCert Inc/OU= www.digicert.com/CN=DigiCert High Assurance CA-3; --- Enclosed is a copy of the message. A message from a student from this course: yyy.ac.il< ccc@gmail.com >: 173.194.66.27 failed after I sent the message. Remote host said: 550-5.7.1 Unauthenticated email from yahoo.com is not accepted due to domain's 550-5.7.1 DMARC policy. Please contact administrator of yahoo.com domain if 550-5.7.1 this was a legitimate mail. Please visit 550-5.7.1 http://support.google.com/mail/answer/2451690 to learn about DMARC 550 5.7.1 initiative. eg1si3281816wib.8 - gsmtp STARTTLS proto=TLSv1; cipher=RC4-SHA; subject=/C=US/ST=California/L=Mountain View/O=Google Inc/CN=mx.google.com; issuer=/C=US/O=Google Inc/CN=Google Internet Authority G2;

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: when teacher's email is yahoo - all emails won't be send
ResponsesInList.Text: This is because Moodle sends emails "from" the user account (yahoo in your case) and mail services don't like that as its a technique used by spammers. In this case Google sees the mail was sent from YOUR server and NOT from a Yahoo server and rejects it. It seems that is due to a tightening of policies by mail providers: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=257981

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: when teacher's email is yahoo - all emails won't be send
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you I guess this is the right tracker for that: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43669 thanks again

ResponsesInList.Title: Moving a Moodle environment from one XP laptop to another
ResponsesInList.Text: I successfully installed EasyPHP 1.7 and Moodle 1.1.1 onto an XP laptop and created some test courses, students etc. I need to move this environment to another XP laptop and keep the Moodle data intact. If I reinstall the EasyPHP software, can I copy the Moodle folders across ? All hints and tips welcome. Thankyou, Rosemary Bennett

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moving a Moodle environment from one XP laptop to another
ResponsesInList.Text: Sure. You can use the build-in backup module from Moodle and backup each course, move the backupfiles to your new installation and restore them or You can export the database using phpmyadmin (included in easyphp) and import the database in your new installation, copy all the files in your moodledata folder and copy them to your new installation. Don't forget to adjust your config.php for the new situation.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moving a Moodle environment from one XP laptop to another
ResponsesInList.Text: Koen Thanks for your reply. I went through the complete installation process for EasyPHP and Moodle on the second laptop, including creating a new Moodle database. Then I dropped the database in Phpmyadmin, recreated a new one and imported the database from laptop1. This worked OK, but is it possible to import the data earlier in the process ? Rosemary Bennett

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moving a Moodle environment from one XP laptop to another
ResponsesInList.Text: As I can follow your proces, you first created a new working moodle and then imported the data. That's not nessesary: You can make anempty database, fill it with the backup, move your files and than start up your Moodle for the first time. I think it doesn't make much of a difference, as long as you keep the same Moodleversion.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moving a Moodle environment from one XP laptop to another
ResponsesInList.Text: Koen Thankyou again. I can now see how I can improve the process next time. Also I understand the importance of keepng the same version of  Moodle in the old and new environment. Rosemary

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Any Ideas Please  2.7 help
ResponsesInList.Text: In 2.7 the editor changed to the new Atto editor. It was the TinyMCE editor. Atto is "minimalist" in many ways. So you don't get all the options by default that you had with TinyMCE. You can enable font color and other plugins though. The docs on that and on Atto are here: https://docs.moodle.org/27/en/Text_editor#Atto_HTML_editor If it really is not your cup of tea, you can actually set the default editor for your Moodle back to TinyMCE. There is a setting (somewhere) in : site administration -> plugins -> text editors

ResponsesInList.Title: Redirect URL to ip/sub folder without changing url
ResponsesInList.Text:
I have a local windows server with WAMP and I've installed moodle on this server in www folder. So you can access moodle from here: 78.93.44.123/moodle I have a cPanel account with Hostgator. I want my students to access the moodle website from outside the college by: moodle.mcst.edu.sa not 78.93.44.123/moodle. i.e. I do not want them to see the IP address. So, I've added an A record in Advanced DNS Zone editor in cPanel as the following: moodle.mcst.edu.sa => 78.93.44.123 This will redirect the URL moodle.mcst.edu.sa to the server home page (www/index.php). actually, I want to redirect moodle.mcst.edu.sa => 78.93.44.123/moodle So, I've change the content of www/index.php to be: 
```text
<?php
header( 'Localhost: /moodel' );
?>
```
 This works fine. It redirects: moodle.mcst.edu.sa => 78.93.44.123/moodle But the problem is: The URL changes from: moodle.mcst.edu.sa => 78.93.44.123/moodle which I do not want. I do not want the users to see the IP in address bar. How can I prevent URL changing? should I use .htaccess file and how? Any rwong step I've done? Help me please Thanks Note: I am using Moodle version: 2.4.3+ in www/moodle/config.php I vave: 
```text
$CFG->
wwwroot
 = '
http://78.93.44.123/moodle'
;
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Redirect URL to ip/sub folder without changing url
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi You can update your apache vhost file to have a doc root pointing to your moodle (code) directory.  With the desired URL As the server root. Then em you can update your config.php wwwroot to be the URL desired.

ResponsesInList.Title: View courses without participation at category level
ResponsesInList.Text: System stuff: Moodle 2.6.10 (& 2.6.11 dev), MySQL , IIS , AD auth. Hopefully someone can help. I have been trying to find a way to do this for a couple of weeks on and off now and it's driving me up the wall as it must be possible! The end point is I would like a 'group' of users (e.g. staff) to have moodle/course:view permission to all courses in a given category. I can do this individually by assigning them a role at the category level that has the moodle/course:view permission (eg. giving them the role of Pupil after adding pupils to be able to view without enrolment. But cannot find a way of either automatically giving them the role as an individual based on an AD group or any other way of achieving this. I have managed to do it for the 'Authenticated User' role, but I want to be more specific. The actual scenario is that we would like to create a category 'Staff Room' and have multiple courses in the category relating to Risk Assessments, School Policies, Trip Forms etc. each of which will have their own course owners and 'teachers'. I could enrol them all into each course but it will make their course lists very long. Any help greatly received. Thanks,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: View courses without participation at category level
ResponsesInList.Text: Edit your role in 'Advanced view', then you will see this row: Set: View courses without participation[ moodle/course:view] =Allow Now, they won't appear in the 'Participants' list and won't get any email from courses. HTH

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: View courses without participation at category level
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for your comment William, Unfortunately my question is regarding adding users to a given roles automatically via AD sync or via a cohort.

ResponsesInList.Title: You need to create the directory D:\moodledata with web server write access
ResponsesInList.Text: I am using server 2008 with IIS 7 and I am on moodle 1.9.9. When I browse to the moodle site I get the following error appear 3 times at the top of the page: ERROR: You need to create the directory D:\moodledata with web server write access Now I have done this, and I have even set authenticated users to full control to see if I can get this error to go away, and yet I am still seeing the error. I followed the advice in this (old) help document but to no avail: http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=56935 Any advice would be appreciated. I'm pulling my hair out over this!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You need to create the directory D:\moodledata with web server write access
ResponsesInList.Text: Usually this kind of issues really are permission issues or user account issues. I checked quickly one of your old posts and noticed that in your php info (php.ini) you have open_basedir  D:\IIS\inetpub\ wwwroot You could try first to set open_basedir empty in php.ini - comment it out with ;open_basedir = and restart your server.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You need to create the directory D:\moodledata with web server write access
ResponsesInList.Text: That only bloody worked! Fantastic! You are a gent and a scholar!

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I have recently started using Moodle and am in the process of setting it up to use in a small computer science class. I haven't found an easy way to do the following and hoping someone else has. I would like to create a 'key' for say, 20 multiple choice questions. The questions however would be in the class textbooks. Then students can read from the textbook and input their answers via Moodle. One of the advantages of this is the students can have instance feedback on the questions. So it would work pretty much like a Scantron, except on Moodle. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: Can't you do this with the quiz module?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for getting back! The problem is the quiz module makes this process a lot more complicated and time consuming. Using the quiz module, each question has to be entered one at a time, and the answer choices have to be manually set to a, b, c, & d (since the answer choice field cannot be blank). Also a dummy name for the question has to be set (since it cannot be blank). Then you have to select the correct answer choice using a drop down box. Meanwhile you have to scroll a fair amount while doing all of this. So what I want is two options: "Tell me the number of questions you would like and number of answer choices per questions"

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: Have you looked at importing questions in GIFT format? It's a bit intimidating at first sight but I find it works well for importing many questions at once. http://docs.moodle.org/en/GIFT

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Alick. I briefly looked into GIFT format via your helpful link. It seems to be a better alternative, but still not ideal for what I'm trying to do. For example I still have to denote answer choices, which in my case I don't. I just want it to be a, b, c, & d. I guess I can copy paste this part, change the question name to the number, and change the correct answer to the right multiple choice letter? Any other ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: I think the solution you are looking for is in the following discussion http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=110670 see the comment about using hot potatoes j-close. I am about to try it with some test papers I already have.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for that link Ashley, from what I see j-close is for fill in the gap exercises which is not what I'm looking for. Here is a paraphrasing of what I want again: Students will read questions and answer choices from the hard copy textbook exercises . Suppose the answer to #1 is c, then they would simply fill in c for #1 on a Moodle (or HotPotatoes, or some online) quiz. The Moodle quiz has no question material or actual answer choice material, just a way to fill in the multiple choice answer. Then when submitted it will check the answers against my key. If #1 was actually d, it would be marked wrong. Then the student will refer to the textbook and check answer choice d to see what the correct answer is. Really similar to how a scantron works. My reasoning is that I have great paper based resources, and do not want to convert a whole textbook worth of questions/answer choices to Moodle, because of the time factor as well as possible copyright issues. Hope that clears it up! Thanks again for everyone's input.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: If you only want to do multi choice answers, try using the Aiken format is is really easy as below. Q: On which day do we observe Australia Day? A. Everyday B. Not today C. 26 of January D. Tomorrow ANSWER: C [next q] When you save the file use UTF-8 character encoding. Notpad wont do it I know Open Office does have the option. GIFT is the very best format but Q&D you can always export the quiz as GIFT latter John

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: John, thank you! This is of course still a work around, but it works well for what I'm trying to do. Surely beats entering in questions one at a time. You also mentioned that GIFT is the best format, any particular reason? To sum up the solution here is what my text file looks like in Aiken format: Q: [1] A. A B. B C. C D. D ANSWER: [A] Where [1] and [A] would be changed manually for each question before uploading. Also it was necessary to disable scrambling within questions in the quiz settings. Also since I'm on a Mac I'm using Smultron which has UTF-8 encoding (nice tip). This was my first time posting to the forum and it's great to see such an active community, thanks again everyone. Best, Ravi

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: No Probs Ravi, Great to see you got it, the down side of Aiken is you don't have the ability to put feed back on wrong answer. GIFT is the most comprehensive format, it can handle the works, including Cloez (Missing word), weighted answers and feed back. The down side is its harder to learn. If you have programming skills you should not find it to hard otherwise trial and error. Who said Life Long Learning was just for the students? Personally I have found working with Moodle one of great stimulation. John

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple Choice on Moodle- Questions on Paper
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Thanks again for the help, I have created a YouTube video to explain the Aiken format process: Enjoy!

ResponsesInList.Title: Deleting Multiple Students and their Assignments
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Can anyone please tell me if it is possible to delete multiple students with one command and also remove their assignments with them? I seem to remember that it may be possible to remove several/many students at once, but the assignments were problematic (and removing them without using moodle might break some things - not sure about this last thing). I would appreciate any assistance - thank you. Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleting Multiple Students and their Assignments
ResponsesInList.Text: The most appropriate time to delete students and assignments is when a course has completed. At that time, go to Course > Administration > Reset and that will delete everything in that course connected to Students. If you are looking to delete individual students and their accounts and everything associated with that Student, or group of students, from the Front Page go to Administration ► Users ► Accounts ► Bulk user actions Select the students you want to delete, adding them to the Selected list, and then using the With selected users dialogue, delete them.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleting Multiple Students and their Assignments
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much Colin, I appreciate your help. Andrew

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 500 User Limit
ResponsesInList.Text: We have some course with more than 2500 Students. And in the System more than 60 000. For Quiz at the same time (concurrent Users) You need about 1 GB memory (RAM) for 50 Users.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 500 User Limit
ResponsesInList.Text: Nope... Moodle doesn't impose a limit on the number of users. Your hardware might (effectively) impose a limit on the number of people doing something at the same time.
