ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automated_backups: Could not open input file in cronjob
ResponsesInList.Text: The cron job for that version of Moodle now consist of a series of 'scheduled task' to be performed from a task list.   When you setup the cron for the main Moodle cron it includes autobackups IF scheduled. See: http://yoursite/admin/tool/task/scheduledtasks.php To execute a separate automated backup cron job from the OS (ie, crontab), try to use the task. in moodlecode/admin/tool/task/cli/ there is a script called 'schedule_task.php' which can be used to call a specific task (like autobackup). The 'help' on that script, run from the command line, shows: Options: --execute=\\some\\task  Execute scheduled task manually --list                List all scheduled tasks -h, --help            Print out this help and the example provided in the help shows: sudo -u www-data /usr/bin/php admin/tool/task/cli/scheduled_task.php --execute=\\\\core\\\\task\\\\session_cleanup_task You would be working with \core\task\automated_backup_task. The following executed from the location of that script does work: php schedule_task.php --execute=\\core\\task\\automated_backup_task and will outout the something like the following: Execute scheduled task: Automated backups (core\task\automated_backup_task) Checking automated backup status...INACTIVE ... used 0 dbqueries ... used 0.10020112991333 seconds Scheduled task complete: Automated backups (core\task\automated_backup_task) IF auto backups was set to active it would have executed. So do what you've been doing .. first test command from command line, then enter command into crontab ... knowing that crontab on Linux might also need something for the 'friggin' \ characters required. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: This forum post has been removed
ResponsesInList.Text: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automated_backups: Could not open input file in cronjob
ResponsesInList.Text: Hmmmm ... 'a good idea' ... now I know you didn't really mean that as one might read it. :| Before going further, try: php ./schedule_task.php blah blah blah See the ./ in front?   Stands for present working directory. You should NOT have to hack/edit any script. There is a PHP environment issue on your system. Which is what?   What is your system?  Operating system wise.  What does: uname -rn show? What does php -v show? What does: php -i |grep include_path show? In the schedule_task.php file the top 4-5 lines it has already: define('CLI_SCRIPT', true); require(__DIR__ . '/../../../../config.php'); require_once("$CFG->libdir/clilib.php"); require_once("$CFG->libdir/cronlib.php"); Access to those are required in order to be able to run the script. You should not have to add anything to the config.php file itself. So in your moodle code directory, in libdir is there a clilib.php file? is there a cronlib.php file? And, the version of PHP must be at least 5.3 or higher. In order to run 3.1.1 of Moodle, your PHP has to be higher than 5.3. However, having said that, it is possible you have multiple versions of PHP on your server . which php will show the path to the php a command that begins with php ... blah, blah would find. Using that path you see in output of which php find out version. /path/to/php -v Let's also see what else is in /path/to/ related that begins with php: ls -l /path/to/php* Above is on CentOS 5 and 6 and 7. I don't need to run any script using sudo *IF* I am logged on as 'root' user.  Now I know the help shows using 'sudo' in execution ... but  that's simply not true on systems where sudo isn't required.   If you are the true root user, sudo isn't required. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Automated_backups: Could not open input file in cronjob
ResponsesInList.Text: I have personal preference for sending autobackups to a desginated backup directory. IF they fail, I know where to find them - moodledata/temp/backup/ If they succeed, having a designated directory means I can see them by humanly recognizable names ... with date/time stamps in the filenames themselves (they might have reference in the DB but are NOT lost in the sea of moodledata/filedir/) If Logged on and manually doing the backups via Course Admin menu, those go to moodledata/filedir/ and they will display in the GUI - tagged as private area but they are still the 'sea'. I actually setup a file system repo .... /moodledata/repository/backups/ and then point the autobackups to that location. I can still get to those backups for restore by setting up the file system repo in a course, then pointing that to /moodledata/repository/backups/   Don't have to have that setup in every course ... just one course. Now if autobackups is still messed up ... possibly related to the DB tables that reference backups.  Found that when I played with it too much setting different options I manged to confuse the system (and myself) and somehow got the dates for a scheduled backup already past the present or upcoming date ... in other words, that one course would *never* be backed up ... not for a year! So, the only way to gain control over autobackups again was to truncate the tables storing auto backup information. ﻿ mdl_backup_controllers mdl_backup_courses mdl_backup_logs That 0'd out any tracking Moodle was doing with all backups.  No harm done cause it's not working anyway! Then ran the autobackups as manual just one time ... moodlecode/admin/cli/autobackup.php That will take whatever defaults there are for course backups and create ONE backup for all courses ... to Moodle none have been backed up and place them in a directory where I can find them ... see them ... and IF desired, even tinker with them. Once I saw that succesful, then set the schedule to be non-prime time at such a time where I thought they would all complete ... like 12:30 PM on every other day. They have been working since and have not had to fiddle with any of it.    Fingers Crossed. Now if there are 10 courses added and a couple of those are huge, then things might start to degrade and I might have to revisit the planning, scheduling etc. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Download all documents in a course
ResponsesInList.Text: There is an increasing demand for this functionality and has been raised at a number of MoodleMoots recently. A working party did look at it earlier this year at MootAu15, and if I heard correctly, there has been a proposal to make it part of core in the future. How long this will take I don't know. While this is a good idea for a small Moodle, or perhaps for Categories or even courses, a site wide zipped file could be  of massive size. Even with using the .tar.gz format just creating the zip would likely break the Moodle, use up all the resources on a server which may not be welcomed on a shared server. I have seen some courses, particularly those using videos, higher end graphics and even sound files, going well over 4gb, so this sort of functionality needs to be very carefully considered as to how it is to be implemented in a site.

ResponsesInList.Text: Okay, now */5 * * * * php /home/balazs2/public_html/moodle/admin/cron.php >/dev/null will run once an hour. Is that good? I would consider setting the cron to run a maximum of once every hour to be safe."

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: php script for cron jobs
ResponsesInList.Text: HI Tom, This cron entry: */5 * * * * php /home/balazs2/public_html/moodle/admin/cron.php >/dev/null will run every 5 minutes. This part:  */5  means to run every 5 minutes. If you want it to run every hour, ten minutes past the hour, you would need to do this: 10 * * * * php /home/balazs2/public_html/moodle/admin/cron.php >/dev/null There is a lot of more information on the 'net regarding the cron settings. However, this setting above will get you started.

ResponsesInList.Title: How do you structure the courses / content into a Moodle tree?
ResponsesInList.Text: At the very root of the tree you have admin, then above that the trunk, you have, perhaps, a moodle page which acts like a landing site for all members of the institution. It is the first moodle page they would see. Here they would find a link to their particular moodle course page. And then that page would ... what... have a different moodle page for each module in the course? Or what? I hope you can understand what I mean. What is the best way to structure an organizations courses and the content units within a course?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do you structure the courses / content into a Moodle tree?
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear N N I am not sure what you mean here. The structure of moodle is perhaps (?!) *fairly* inflexible, (moodlers, please show me I am wrong!) but most often *entirely adequate* for teachers. 'Inflexible' often means good because it is simple and easy to understand. ( Ilias for example has, perhap,s a more flexible resource heirarchy but it looks reallly difficult to use to me.) Generally, in Moodle at the top of the content tree/heirarchy one has the site (course number 1) and on that site/course page there is the list of courses OR categories of courses, and the courses generally have serval "topics" or "weeks" with " activities /resources" ("modules") inside them. These activities/resources are in a sequence, without structural depth. The categories of course can be nested indefinately. Facitilities for the structure of content at lower levels (such as modules within modules) are fairly limited, perhaps. The Lesson and Scorm modules have the functionality to provide depth of a sort. There is some new code somewhere for heirarchical topics/weeks.  I looked for the past 15 minutes but I can't find the forum. Please will someone remind us where it is? You may also be interested in this thread where we are discussing other possible heirarchies. Timothy

ResponsesInList.Title: How can I ban an IP address from accessing my site?
ResponsesInList.Text: How can I ban a certain IP address from accessing my site? Any help will be greatly appreciated...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How can I ban an IP address from accessing my site?
ResponsesInList.Text: ban via php: http://www.phpfreaks.com/quickcode/Ban_IP_Addresses_from_Your_Website/78.php ban via apache/httpd.conf: http://www.phpkitchen.com/article.php?story=20020907100923943 ban via apache/.htaccess http://www.lissaexplains.com/forum/showthread.php?threadid=18998 Best regards, Andreas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How can I ban an IP address from accessing my site?
ResponsesInList.Text: add the following to a file called .htaccess which should be in the root of your webserver ie: /www/myaccount/public_html/.htaccess <Limit GET HEAD POST> order allow,deny deny from 200.174.151.122 deny from 203.222.151.66 deny from 211.152.14.96 deny from 212.235.110.99 deny from 213.204.212.153 deny from 216.240.136.222 deny from 24.101.46.193 deny from 24.156.24.170 deny from 24.167.75.133 deny from 66.143.183.179 deny from 67.114.147.154 deny from 68.123.196.18 deny from 69.56.208.106 deny from 69.56.215.122 deny from 69.93.129.74 deny from 69.93.207.2 deny from 69.93.38.130 deny from 69.93.48.122 deny from 80.178.68.70 deny from 80.179.0.37 deny from 80.181.182.148 deny from 80.232.169.174 deny from 80.61.129.224 deny from 82.166.67.76 deny from 82.197.197.79 allow from all </LIMIT> and just ip addresses as the nasties present themselves. To see where I get the list above from visit: http://bots.pcpropertymanager.com/modules.php?name=BS_IPCheats Sarah

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How can I ban an IP address from accessing my site?
ResponsesInList.Text: Ashary, Another method if you have server access via CPanel is to use the IP Deny Manager Best of luck Jeff

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Forum Maintenance
ResponsesInList.Text: Each new school year, rather than delete whole forums and then creating them again, is there a simple or easier way to delete all student posts from the previous school year?  It is labor intensive to individually delete the posts.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Forum Maintenance
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ed, there was a post similar to this a few weeks ago but they wanted to be able to setup a new year group and store the previous year, if I remember rightly they did this be renaming the existing database table and creating a new one for the new year, not sure if this is much help but if you go back over the last 2 weeks of posts I am sure you will come across it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Forum Maintenance
ResponsesInList.Text: There are a couple of ways to do this. One, you can reset the course which will give the option of clearing entries for other items, also. To me, the simplest way is to just duplicate the forum. The new one will be setup with all the same details, but with no entries. You can then delete the previous version, or hide it if you need to keep a record of previous entries.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Object Code Video Shows in Description but Black Screen in Wiki
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, It may start being the same bits of code pasted into the two sections , however the output is that the code in the main section of a wiki page is getting mangled as it is being interpretted as wiki text. Since the allowScriptAccess param is being changes from always to never, then I suspect that it is based on the different options which are being used to call lib/htmlpurifier on the text being processed. The key to the problem seems to be trying to embed a flash object which has a separate loader "bootstap.swf", and a data file listed in the flashvars parameter - content= http://content.screencast.com/users/DoorCountySolar/folders/900%20-%20Marketing%20Plan/media/e91f54cd-f049-4694-a773-479e5ad68253/gfgdfgdfgdfgfdg.swf . The flashvars param seems to be working the the summary area, but disappearing when the code is included in the main body of the wiki. There might be a way to sidestep all of this complexity.  If you have swf option turned on in the moodle media filters, have you tried just including a simple link to the content of the screencast: Screencast 1 With any luck, the moodle filter should write out a flash object to embed the swf file.  You can also specify the height and width by adding  ...fdg.swf?d=640x320" With screencast.com, be careful to use the file specified by the content= variable hidden in the flashvars instead of the bootstrap.swf file. You may lose some of the advantages of using a the bootstap loader and having a nice poster image while loading, but it might work for the situation you describe. -- Sean Farrell Edinburgh, Scotland

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Object Code Video Shows in Description but Black Screen in Wiki
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, It is also possible that you may fix things by looking out for colons in the content of the params. > Could you perhaps try urlencoding the flashvar attribute, in particular the colon > character to become %3A. > I wonder if this will stop the html attribute being rewritten for you? -- Sean Farrell Edinburgh, Scotland

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Object Code Video Shows in Description but Black Screen in Wiki
ResponsesInList.Text: Sean, I am not sure if you use the same saying in Scotland "Can't have your cake and eat it too"? but... I just did! While I was waiting for help I continues to play around with it and ended up with an even better alternative. I opened a sample SWF (presentation video) Did a sceen-capture of the video and saved to .png Pulled the image into Fireworks, sized it to fit and placed a "Click Anywhere to View Video" over the top. Grouped the two into a single .png FTP 'd the image to my regular website Navigated to the web page, right clicked and used "copy image location" Tabbed over to my Moodle site and inside the Description box Clicked on the Insert Image and then pasted the URL of the image Tabbed back over to the Web page again and opened the SWF which places the URL of the Flash into the URL line. Copied that path. Went back to my Moodle site, clicked on the image and then on the Moodle Media icon (2.0). Pasted the URL of the SWF and added a title. There are a number of things I like about this in lieu of my previous embed of Object Code: The page loads much faster because it is only loading an image rather than part of an embedded video When clicking on the image the video opens full screen based on the settings of the Flash video (set to allow resizing) If I want to use the same image and video somewhere else I can just copy and paste it. That picks up the image URL and the SWF URL If I change the image (via my website) or the SWF on my website then all of those changes are updated on all uses in Moodle. In the Wiki it works the same up top in the Description block as it does in the lower (wiki) section. No issues like I had with the embed code. Much easier to explain how to do this to others authorized to edit the wiki. They do not need to go into the HTML to perform this task. P.S. I did find it was even cleaner if I 1st created a single row/column table, placed a background color in it and a 9px border then placed the image and linked video inside that single cell. The table obeyed my request to center itself in the block whereas the image without the table wanted to hang to the left. I would say that is "still having the cake and eating it". Thanks for all your help. Let me know if you see any flaws in this method. Mike Here is sample. Enter as Guest http://workshops.therenewablenetwork.com/mod/wiki/view.php?id=3

ResponsesInList.Text: hi my moodle version: moodle 3.4 i want show download icon in the video.js player.how can i do that? i find this github but i don't understand how to implement that in the moodle. please help me about show download icon in player or other solution. thank you

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to show Download icon in videojs
ResponsesInList.Text: This is not a specific Moodle issue, Videojs does not have a native download button I understand. Having said that, you can add any code, say the code for that button, into Site Admin > Appearance > Additional HTML. Add it for all pages so if a videojs is used in that page, the download button should appear. Suggest you start at the Video.js player guides for help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to show Download icon in videojs
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Sadaf, I checked this in our Moodle 3.3 and as far as I can see, the VideoJS player as it works in Moodle already creates a download link in the controls. This works for Chrome browser and I'm sure this also works in other up-to-date browsers. If you would like to disable the download button, use the following code in the video tag: 
```text
<video controls controlsList="nodownload">...</video>
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Deleted file is still visible
ResponsesInList.Text:
A little more than a year back we provided to our students
an article on the frontpage of our Moodle site ( www.cfpscourseweb.com .... which is
being upgraded). When we discovered that it was copyright, we deleted it from
the frontpage and provided same within the course where it still is at http://www.cfpscourseweb.com/pluginfile.php/4170/mod_resource/content/1/Opening%20Harts%20Concept%20of%20Law.pdf Evidently one needs to login to access the
article. Such access is permitted. Even though we deleted the file from the frontpage, when a
search is done on the web the deleted article still appears at http://www.cfpscourseweb.com/pluginfile.php/2815/block_html/content/Opening%20Harts%20Concept%20of%20Law-16-01-16.pdf We have been questioned by the Licensing Authority and have
explained matters concerning the above article and 6 others in the same
situation. Is there any way in which such files in limbo can be fully deleted? Charles Fernando

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleted file is still visible
ResponsesInList.Text: I tried this.... - I added a file (as a link) in an HTML block - I added the same file in a file resource in a course - I deleted the file from the HTML block leaving the link in the text. Still accessible - I deleted the file from the file resource... still accessible from the front page block This sounds like a bug. However, make sure your cron is running (properly). Cron cleans up deleted files (eventually) EDIT: I did try it with a different file placing it in a front page HTML block and then deleting it again - it immediately becomes inaccessible as expected. So, having it in multiple places does seem critical to this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleted file is still visible
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Charles, I may be completely wrong here, but this looks to me like a search engine issue. If you embedded this document (or linked to it) on your front page, then it appears that the search engine has picked up the link and is still showing it.  The fact that the front page is now different doesn't alter the address of the source material.  If that is the case, then it means that the article (or directory where it is saved) is accessible to the public if they know the correct address. This may not be your situation, but from what you describe it's certainly possible. All the best Andy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleted file is still visible
ResponsesInList.Text: That was my first thought... except the link still *works*. That's his problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleted file is still visible
ResponsesInList.Text: Might have to use some DB queries on the DB for the Moodle to find the file Query: select contenhash,component,filearea,filename from `mdl_files` where (`filename` like "%16-01-16.pdf.pdf") ; *If* the link to the PDF was in an HTML block then component will show htmlblock. component filearea will show resources. The contenthash shows the location in /moodledata/filedir/ 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Database Cleanup Preferences
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I was wondering if anyone already had any further documentation on the particular tables that are purged via the gradehistorylifetime preference?  I was curious if it includes the latest record of all graded items that are purged, or if it is just the additional details of auditing activities and changes? I have been reviewing our database growth and already have a process in place to replicate the activity log to a separate DB so that we can let the cron job prune our Moodle DB.  I would like to be able to do similar things for our largest tables (in # of records) as the top 6 have hundreds of thousands to millions of rows each: question_attempt_steps question_attempt_step_data certificate_linked_modules question_attempts log question_answers grade_grades_history question question_multichoice question_usages quiz_attempts grade_grades quiz_grades But I want to make sure I better understand what will be left in the active system for grade history, and to make sure I capture all of the tables that we might need to reference later in the separate, logs DB. Another table on the list is certificate_linked_modules.  It really seem like it is just 1.5 million unnecessary records.  Anyone have any idea purging it / preventing future growth? And I need to dig some more about our quiz setups to see if we might just be able to log less of the audit stuff there.  And though we have a lot of students, we do not offer all that many different courses so it seems strange that our question table makes the list.  We tend to clone existing courses for new iterations so I would only have expected references to that table to be growing, rather than the number of question entries themselves.  So if anyone else has been digging in these areas it would be great to collaborate. I have added some (ms sql ) scripts if anyone wants a head start doing the same type of separate log DB.  Just create the db and then play in the scripts in order to create the tables and Stored Procedure.  You can then schedule the SP to run daily prior to the cron job.  It will keep backing up the new activity log entries, and then also gives you an entry in the history table to help check back that the process is working properly. If I end up having to dig into code and test to find the answers about some of those tables then I will post back to this thread.  And hopefully by then I will have dug up my epoch to sql datetime function so I can put together a purge job for the second db as well.  That way we can purge Moodle at perhaps something aggressive like 90 days, but keep the secondary records for a few years. Thank You, Kyle

They have 150 classes and need to separate students by group, with each group having one teacher. Is there a way to globally assign a teacher to a group? So, to summarize my ideal scenario: Create one group with an enrollement key tied to it, assign a teacher to that group, and let students enroll in that group using an enrollment key. That group would be propogated to all courses in a category specified. I'm probably just missing something here, so if someone could just point me in the right direction, I'd appreciate it. Glen

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Site-wide teachers in groups?
ResponsesInList.Text: You could do it with a flat file upload - username, password, firstname, lastname, email, course1, group1, role1, course2, group2, role 2 and so on where course1 is the first course you want them in and group 1 is their group name and role1 is student or editing teacher accordingly - if you did it in spreadsheet software you'd just have to copy the group1 name to the other courses if it was the same group. There is information in Moodle_Docs on this in the uploading users section

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Site-wide teachers in groups?

The idea is to automate this as much as possible, as we have several thousand registered users on our moodle installation. I'll keep exploring other options.

ResponsesInList.Title: Add Content to Every Course Created
ResponsesInList.Text: If I've already got 30-40 courses created but want to add a piece of content to all of them, is there a way to do this without going into each and every course? For example, if I wanted to add a copyright disclaimer as the last section of each course...is that possible without doing it in each course individually? Version: 2.8.X

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add Content to Every Course Created
ResponsesInList.Text: Not that I am aware of, unless you are able to attach something through the course page footer, perhaps, but that means you will have to understand how themes work and your particular theme at that. Without knowing how css and PHP work, it will be a real challenge. I know, lots of work, but you can make it a bit easier for yourself, write it once, in a label at the end of the course, then copy the raw text, in code format, paste that into a label in a course. If it requires an image, then you can use the image once and the absolute reference made by the code to the image should make it work properly. Sorry I haven't got better news, but someone else may have an easier method.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add Content to Every Course Created
ResponsesInList.Text: You could add text to the footer of your site - it would then put it on every page, not just the bottom section of each course - but you'd only have to do it once. Site administration>Appearance>Additional HTML

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add Content to Every Course Created
ResponsesInList.Text:
I like Mary's idea. If there is some reason you don't want the content visible on every course and you are comfortable with sql you could do a table update like this. update mdl_course_sections set summary =concat("new content
",summary) where id in (select sectionid from temp_newcontenttable); That is mysql syntax but there will be something similar for other databases. It appends the new contents to the start of the first section in the course. The new content was actually the tags for a filter and the temp_newcontenttable contained the i'ds of courses that were to be updated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Often errors with Moodle database
ResponsesInList.Text: I started to run myisamchk because of a problem with another ( MySQL ) database but discovered when I had repaired it, that the Moodle database has problems with its' indexes. The check is done with /usr/local/bin/myisamchk --fast --silent /var/db/my sql /*/*.MYI and the repair is done with /usr/local/bin/myisamchk -r /var/db/mysql/ncm_vle/*.MYI It is a low traffic server with ca 10 different MySQL databases (php 4.3.3, apache 1.3.28, MySQL 3.23.57, FreeBSD 5.0) and it doesn't show any other signs of abnormal behaviour. Abbreviated output: - recovering (with sort) MyISAM-table '/var/db/mysql/ncm_vle/mdl_chat_messages.MYI' Data records: 9

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: not errors with Moodle database
ResponsesInList.Text: Don't panic - this is not necessarily an indication of corruption or errors - myisamchk is just rebuilding (recovering) the indexes exactly like you asked it to. phpMyAdmin has a better interface for this stuff.

ResponsesInList.Title: Students Cannot See Their grades
ResponsesInList.Text: Students cannot see their own grades on our Moodle 3.4 install. After much searching the forums I note that: - The student role has been granted permission to view their own grades. A look in the roles capability tables shows the student roll has a "1" for permissions. - The course itself is set to allow students to see their marks and - In the quiz setup grades are not set to hidden generally, nor are they set to be hidden until a certain date. When a student clicks on "grades" in the course navigation block they get this message, "Sorry, but you do not currently have permissions to do that (View grades of other users)" The url that opens upon clicking in the course navigation block is "grade/report/grader/index.php?id=10" (10 being the course id#) Just in case it matters, the template I am using is "clean" That's what I've got after boiling down the last 3 hours, lol. Thanks for your time and help in this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students Cannot See Their grades
ResponsesInList.Text: The URL from the navigation block for students should say user/ and not grader Are you sure there have been no customisations to the theme or code?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students Cannot See Their grades
ResponsesInList.Text: I think your students have the wrong role. This url is for a teacher http://localhost/grade/report/grader/index.php?id=2 This is the url for a student http://localhost/grade/report/user/index.php?id=2 I also suspect that the role they have is one without grades. Thus, the logic of trying to see your own grades when you don't have a grade might default to, "Oh, you're trying to see others' grades. No can do." But that's speculation. Edit: Back in 2014, Tim Hunt thought these were the permissions that need to allowed. They may have changed. "Students should only have gradereport/overview:view, gradereport/user:view and moodle/grade:view, I think." https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=MOODLE-UK;961efd9a.1401

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students Cannot See Their grades
ResponsesInList.Text: Ben, Thanks for that. Indeed, students were missing one of the roles mentioned in your edit. I could not find "moodle/grade:view" but one of the others was missing. For other searchers, the role permissions I have that allow a student to see their own grades when they click on grades in the navigation panel are the following: Grade report: Overview report - "View the overview report" set to allow Grade report: User report - " View your own grade report" set to allow Course: - "View own grades" set to allow Course: - "View grades" set to allow Thanks for the help!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students Cannot See Their grades
ResponsesInList.Text: Very good! And you're right to thank Mary for her sharp eyes!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students Cannot See Their grades
ResponsesInList.Text: Mary, Thank you for that suggestion and thanks for catching the url difference. No customisations of code were made but I had tinkered with the layout of the theme. I tested with a different unchanged theme and the issue persisted. It turned out to be a permission issue I was missing, as Ben suggested. Thanks for helping me rule things out! Tim

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Site Administration missing - is it a bug?
ResponsesInList.Text: How long after you installed that Moodle version has this happened? I am assuming that you mean the dockable Admin Panel that resides on the left column of the screen. Run it as normal and it should all work, again. Long fix, track each error message find the one that has buried the Admin panel.

ResponsesInList.Title: Suddently enrolled in a bunch of courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings dear Moodlers, Out of the blue, my moodle users that have the limited administrator role have been enrolled in to a bunch of courses and I don't know how to remove those enrollments without having to touch each course individually. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Suddently enrolled in a bunch of courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Check that they haven't accidentally been enrolled into the category by going to that category and looking at Assign roles. Also check in Assign system roles on your front page site admin that they haven't accidentally been assigned a role system wide. Finally they might have been enrolled into a course in a metacourse set up, which results in them being enrolled in a bunch of other courses but you can't check that without looking in each course. (Note that i am giving the locations from memory as you say you are running 1.9.7 and that is over 5 years old  now)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timeout

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timeout
ResponsesInList.Text: OK no worries, when you mentioned you've set time out of 4 hours, was it PHP you've set into or Apache? There are 3 ways you can set time outs 1: Using .htaccess file ini_set( 'session.gc_maxlifetime' , 14400); 2: Using Apache's config file TimeOut 14400 3: Using php.ini file session.gc_maxlifetime = 14400; you can also set in php.ini session.cache_expire = 15000; and session.cookie_lifetime = 0 (0 donates cookie staying alive until browser windows closes)

Students who come to a lesson late have the advantage of looking at the workshop to get ideas about what & how to write for their essay. Set the upload to notify the teacher and that should trigger it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Linking to topic sections v 1.9.5
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. I haven't looked at the blog Mary linked to, but I've done this before, and I instead used <course-url>#section-x.  x would be 1 for the first section, technically the 2nd if you include the general, top-most one, and so on. So, using this site's Using Moodle course as an example, where its URL is http://moodle.org/course/view.php?id=5 , I used http://moodle.org/course/view.php?id=5#section-1 to get to the first topic (note the first past the general section, so arguably the 2nd topic), http://moodle.org/course/view.php?id=5#section-2 to get to the 2nd (called Moodle Core), etc. Cheers

ResponsesInList.Title: Uploading Folders of .doc Files
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle 1.8. How can I insert multiple .doc files into one folder, then upload that folder to my class site so my students can access it? Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Uploading Folders of .doc Files
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there. You need to put all your worksheets into one folder offline, then right click and choose "send to compressed/zipped folder" That makes the folder again but with a zip on it. Go to your course page and in the course admin block where it says files click in there. Upload your zipped folder NOT your original (it will end in .zip ) as if you were uploading only one Then when it is done click on unzip. You will get a list of the files and just click OK at the bottom. Go to the middle section of your course. You can either then do Add a resource>link to a file or website and display them one at a time (boring and hard on the eye) or else you can select : add a resource>display a directory which will give you the option to choose the whole folder as a kind of yellow suitcase - and students click inside the link to see all the docs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Backup.php missing
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi folks, I'm using Moodle 2.0.2 and when I click "Backup" I get the error: The requested URL /moodle/backup/backup.php was not found on this server . Additionally, a 404 Not Found
error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request I have searched in vain for answers on this topic.  Any advice? Thank you! James p.s. I'm trying to duplicate a course to create a similar but slightly different version of the course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backup.php missing
ResponsesInList.Text: If you can access your Moodle code, then look in the backup directory for the backup.php file. Sounds like something is not setting the path to the files correctly so my bet would be the file is there. What is your Moodle path? DOes it really reflect the actual location of your Moodle. Usually this means someone has moved something or the config.php file is using a static path statement like: $CFG-> wwwroot = ' http://mysite.org/moodle' ; when it might be better using something like: $CFG->wwwroot   = 'http://' . $_SERVER['HTTP_HOST'] . '/moodle'; Check the config.php file, that supplies the basic path to all Moodle actions, check it is aiming to the right place.

I have tried shortname, which is the field in which our course code are in and subsequently filled in the feild with the course codes but this just throws an error.  Stating the shortname doesnt exist Cheers

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bulk User.csv
ResponsesInList.Text: You can get all the information you need about this in this page: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Upload_users Concerning the password change info look for " Force password change: Set the password field for desired users to changeme ." About the enrollment, the shortname should be ok, look for " The course names are the "shortnames" of the courses - if present then the user will be enrolled in those courses."

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bulk User.csv
ResponsesInList.Text: Not very usfull Sorry but i have looked and have tried calling the field "Force Password Chnange" and setting the value as changme.  Doesnt work and have tried to name the course field as shortname with the course code as the value.  But that doesnt work either Albert

I have made my server accessible from the Internet, but it has different domain names on the Internet side and the home side. This seems to cause problems when I upload files. I uploaded image files from the Internet side and included them in a glossary, and images display fine from that side, but not from my home side where I just get the file name in the glossary entry. If I right-click and get image properties it has the domain name from the Internet side included, and that will not work when I access if from home. However, if I follow Adminstration->Files and hover over the file names they include my home-side domain name. Is there any setting that would make file names self-relative? Or are there any bodges I can carry out? Tony Chabot

ResponsesInList.Title: Change my login username for this forum?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change my login username for this forum?
ResponsesInList.Text: You can change your first name and last name, the other users don't see your username (except admin users). Click on your own name anywhere in Moodle, click on "edit profile" (should be in the "settings" block).

ResponsesInList.Text: Any ideas at all?  Anyone?

ResponsesInList.Title: Requiring specific email domains for authentication
ResponsesInList.Text: I would like to set Moodle to only allow subscribers (students) to use a school email domain for registering.  Anything but our domain would be blocked. Is this possible?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Requiring specific email domains for authentication
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, in the config.php file, uncomment this line: //      $CFG->allowemailaddresses = "myschool.edu.au hotmail.com"; and put in your own domain(s) instead of "myschool.edu.au hotmail.com".

ResponsesInList.Title: adding moodle system data to html form fields
ResponsesInList.Text: we have an html page using form commands (not PHP) that is in classrooms as a page resource for requesting classroom changes. the page requires the user to enter their name, email, department, classroom name, etc. Moodle knows my name, email, what classroom I am currently looking at, etc. Is there anyway to load these moodle parameters into the html form before it is displayed so users don't have to fill out so much information by hand? We are a hosted Moodle site and do not have access to our backend for building PHP files. We have to refer these types of changes to our hosting site. We are using Moodle 2.5 and would like to do this in the front end as a resource page. Jon Scherbatskoy - Admin and Instructional Developer Norwich University - CGCS, Northfield, VT

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: adding moodle system data to html form fields
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe you would have to add PHP to your HTML page and grant that page privileges. I'm pretty sure you your hosting company would need to be involved in some form. Anyone else have an idea?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: adding moodle system data to html form fields
ResponsesInList.Text: Could you not use an instance of the built in Feedback module instead of your form? I think it would do the job just as well

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle mobile versus Scenarichain Opale
ResponsesInList.Text: I think you mean Moodle in general, not Moodle mobile. Moodle can and is used alone and can do far more than just Scenarichain Opale.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: CVS contrib (how to?)
ResponsesInList.Text: You probably want to use the cvs command line tool or a cvs app to download the contrib folder. http://download.moodle.org/cvs/ replace cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/moodle co moodle with cvs -z3 -d:pserver:anonymous@cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/moodle co contrib

ResponsesInList.Title: SCORM Course Format Not Available
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all One of the administrators of the site mentioned that SCORM is not available under the Course Format. We can pick from Gird, Single Activity, Social, TabFormat, Topics, Collapsed Weeks, and Weekly formats but not SCORM. Can you help me to find out how to enable the SCORM course format? Thank you all in advance. We are running Moodle 2.6 build 2013111800.02.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SCORM Course Format Not Available
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle 2.6 replaced SCORM format with Single Activity format.  Choosing that format and uploading a SCORM module will produce the same effect as the old SCORM format.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SCORM Course Format Not Available
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Christian. That makes a lot of sense, I've passed on this answer to the site admins.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.02 Questions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello All, I have just created our first Moodle site and we are needing some assistance. We are creating a course with 32 videos and I have it setup with a topic format. However we would like the videos to pop up when you click the video file which is happening however i have to go to every topic and set the popup and the size and everything is there an easier way to standardize it? The next question is how to setup the new user registration email to send out it doesn't send the users? The final question is with these videos it here a plugin or something to keep progress of the video for later viewing and start back at the previous spot and track progress and mark complete once it is fully watched? Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks, Dereck

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.02 Questions
ResponsesInList.Text: You ask three questions on different topics.  It might be hard to track replies, but I will begin. #1) Many ways to do videos.  For my technique, see my presentation at MoodleMoot US 2015 (you should be able to log in using your moodle.org credentials). https://mootus.moodlemoot.org/course/view.php?id=29 #2) I use self-registration, meaning "let students set themselves up." On this webpage of mine , look at my "Welcome Email" example. #3) I believe that this would be a video player feature and probably has nothing to do with Moodle.  It is like asking "Is there a PDF reader that can keep track of where you left off?"  Maybe so, but you will need to find the application that works best.

Im thinking that if an assignment submission can be an event then it could trigger access permission for the next topic. Ive found discussions around this area here and here , but Im stuck as to the best option to take. ResponsesInList.Title: Installing plugins to use old themes
ResponsesInList.Text: My school recently updated to (I assume) the latest version of Moodle, and teachers have lost access to the old menu of course themes. We now just have Clean, Snap, and More.  Our admin says that he "doesn't have access at the level" necessary to add the old themes back.  It seems like a simple matter of downloading a plugin file.  Why would my admin not be able to add the old themes back for us, and is there anything we can do about that?  Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Installing plugins to use old themes
ResponsesInList.Text: Whoever upgraded your Moodle has the capability to add back those themes.  The plugin files need to be downloaded and placed in the theme directory.  The Moodle admin then visits the notifications page and the update is triggered.  I would ask again until the person says yes.  It is not a lot of work. I am in the process of updating my school district's Moodle.  I will be using Evolve-D as the site theme.  I plan to add back legacy themes so teachers will have the option of keeping the look they are used to in their courses.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Installing plugins to use old themes
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks very much, Rob.  Are there different levels of Moodle ownership?  I'm sure we have whatever the least expensive option is, if so.  I wonder if having whatever the "economy" version of Moodle is would limit our admins' access to features? I want to push the issue, but it's hard to determine on my end whether the school just doesn't want to bother, or they legitimately can't access plugins.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Installing plugins to use old themes
ResponsesInList.Text: Least expensive is "free". Is your Moodle self hosted or via a Moodle Partner?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Installing plugins to use old themes
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, we use Moodlerooms, so Joule.  From the resources I've browsed, it looks like we'd have to pay a fee for each plugin, and that is only if the old themes are available? I don't understand why they would limit the number of themes.  The new ones look ridiculous on a laptop screen and are not an effective or user-friendly use of screen space.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Installing plugins to use old themes
ResponsesInList.Text: Which version of Moodle were you using before the upgrade? There have been lots of changes to the Moodle theme engine in the last few versions of Moodle and some themes for older versions of Moodle will not work in the current version of Moodle without some modifications. You can't just download an old theme into the current version of Moodle.

Has anyone else done this and got any tips? or am I asking for something which can't be done?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bitnami install package for Windows (local Moodle install)
ResponsesInList.Text: I've done it locally, but not with your install, which I couldn't get to work years ago. It's a simple process. And most of the plugins give you directions. Basically, you unzip the plugin and put its folder in the folder with the appropriate name. Themes go into "Themes" and such. Obviously, turn off your Moodle first. Copy folder into appropriate folder. Turn on Moodle. Login as admin. You will be taken to "Notifications" in Site Admin where you confirm the install. It really is quite simple, and with a local install, if you *truly* mess up, just delete all and start again. Practical example. I use Joseph's RegEx question type. As of Moodle 2+, it requires two other pieces. Each time I forget to install the two other pieces, Moodle notifications tells me I'm a fool and it won't run. I go get the two pieces and put them where they belong, and Moodle says thank you and runs.

ResponsesInList.Title: Configuration Variables MIA

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configuration Variables MIA
ResponsesInList.Text: Ben, who is your host ?  If you are with one host in particular I have a solution to your problem. Marc

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configuration Variables MIA
ResponsesInList.Text: Powweb.com

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configuration Variables MIA
ResponsesInList.Text:
I thought as much, here is the solution... In the admin/config.php you must comment out the following lines around line 149  ... /// Lock some options $httpsurl = str_replace('http://', 'https://', $CFG-> wwwroot ); if ($httpsurl != $CFG->wwwroot) { if (ini_get('allow_url_fopen')) { if ((($fh = @fopen($httpsurl, 'r')) == false) and ($config->loginhttps == 0)) { echo '<script type="text/ javascript ">'."
"; echo '<!--'."
"; echo "eval('document.form.loginhttps.disabled=true');
"; echo '-->'."
"; echo '</script>'."
"; } } } Powweb has limited the use of the Fopen command since they went to load balanced servers. Marc

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configuration Variables MIA
ResponsesInList.Text: Marc, Thank you!!! That's the fix, now are there any potential problems due to this fix? Should I be thinking about changing hosts? I greatly appreciate all the expert advice, Ben

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configuration Variables MIA
ResponsesInList.Text: Ben, glad I could help. My understanding is that removing this code shouldn't affect anything.  I believe this section of code is used to see if a server has https access.  Since Powweb requires that you use a different URL for the secure server, the code shouldn't be relevant to our situation. If I am misinterpreting this code, would one of the developers please chime in. Marc

ResponsesInList.Title: Backup and Restore Course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I am not that familiar with Moodle but we are using 2.7 and I would like to understand whether it is possible to copy an existing course so that I amend the details slightly before making it live. I started by backing up an existing course which worked fine. Is it now a simple case of restoring this course.  Will it overwrite or prompt me to rename it when I restore? Is this the correct and acceptable method of duplicating a course or is there another way? Thanks all

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backup and Restore Course
ResponsesInList.Text: You CAN restore the course by choosing the RESTORE option in the ADMINISTRATION BLOCK of your new course.  During the Restore process you will see a series of check boxes (the data you backed up in your original course) that you can uncheck to eliminate dated or otherwise irrelevant items.  As you progress, you will have the option of MERGING the data into the new course or DELETING THE NEW COURSE and adding the data.  In our institution, we always MERGE so as not to lose enrollments in the new course.  Once the Restore process is complete, you can update any of the data that you moved over. BACKUP/RESTORE is an acceptable method as is the IMPORT method.  We have had issues (in earlier versions of Moodle) with the Import function, so our faculty are in the habit of using B/R as their go-to methos.  Hope this helps

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backup and Restore Course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Edward, thanks for reply. Will that allow us to restore the course and rename during the restore? Ideally, I would like to end up with another course without impacting the existing one so that I can then rename and change the content slightly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Uploading files, not to courses
ResponsesInList.Text: I have setup a file repository in moodledata containing several directories which are relevent to different types of courses. I want tutors to be able to select these for their courses. How can I upload files via a moodle file manager (not FTP like the docs say) ? I have looked into DavRoot but I cant get it to (says reverse proxy error, I am working locally at the moment). Any other solutions? Moodle 2.9

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Uploading files, not to courses
ResponsesInList.Text: If you are working locally on the Moodle Server , you should just be able to copy to the repository, if you can find it. Otherwise, AFAIK , the only way to reach it is FTP. I know.. a pain, but there were a number of security concerns extensively discussed when Repositories were initially introduced. Of course, you could use an external repository, Dropbox, for example, but that too can cause other problems.... That is why I really prefer to be working locally on a Moodle server, makes so many things so much easier.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Uploading files, not to courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Whether you can upload files to a https://docs.moodle.org/en/File_system_repository through Moodle, No, not to my knowledge. But unlike the original repostories https://docs.moodle.org/en/Private_files , https://docs.moodle.org/en/Server_files_repository , etc. a File system repository is just a directory in the file system of the server. There are dozens of ways of uploading files to a server other than HTTP: FTP, SFTP, SCP, Samba, WebDav, rsync, ... Talk to your system administrator.

ResponsesInList.Title: Cloze Test
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, we are using 1.4.4, however, we have still the following problem: {1:SHORTANSWER:%100%Enclosed~%50%enclosed}. When evaluating the test, the program gives 100 % for all solutions. Is it possible to correct this? Regards Joachim Schäfer

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cloze Test
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Joachim, As far as I know the cloze text question in the quiz tool is not case sensitive. You could improvise by dividing the cloze text over a number of short answer questions, because those can be case sensitive. The difference is of course that you can only have one gap per text piece/sentence and that the fill in box does not appear in the text, but under it. It is not such a graceful solution, but it works fine. Rgrds, Paul.

ResponsesInList.Title: Advice for creating groups, etc
ResponsesInList.Text: I need some advice on setting up our Moodle 2.0 site. We have grades and within each grade groups and each group does a number of subjects. We want a Moodle course for each subject, for example Grade 8 has 5 groups, 8A, 8B, 8C, 8D and 8E. Each group does 8 subjects like Maths, English, with different teachers. I started with a Meta Course approach and enrolled all the Grade 8 into the parent but found I could not pass the groups down to the child. Do I have to create the groups in the child then, this makes managing more tricky then, ideally, all the enrolment and group setup should be done in the parent, unless I am missing the point. Any ideas on the best structure for this. Many thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Advice for creating groups, etc
ResponsesInList.Text: Make the parent the groups, each one of them a course then connect to the child course, the materials. There is a strong perceptual issue with meta courses. The parent course always contains the students and the child course always contains the course materials. (I do not understand why this was done, this means the parent is always changing but the child never does.. oh well..)Groups are not necessarily used in meta courses. If you are going to break students into specific classes, then you can just have an ordinary course, where all students are enrolled, and use groups within that course. You do not need a meta course for this. However, having had over 150 students in one course, and 6 groups, with three teachers, believe me, meta courses appear a far more attractive method. I might get the opportunity to find out this year...

Traced the problem to the file /course_menu/xtree/xtree.php line 143 while ($howmany + 1 > $sum) { $chapNo++; $sum += $chapCount[$chapNo]; } The error log indicates that the program is stuck in this loop as it continually generates this error I've disabled the course_menu block but we have used this for a couple of years now without problem so my real concern is that it is failing because of some problem with the course sections themselves.

ResponsesInList.Title: Course restore 'Restore as manual enrolments' option
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, hope someone can assist. We have been restoring the courses with the option: ' Restore
as manual enrolments' ticked. What does this do?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course restore 'Restore as manual enrolments' option
ResponsesInList.Text: What it says. Any user enrolments will come back as 'manual' regardless of what they were in the original course. This is useful if you restore on a site that does not have the same plugins enabled. For example, if you used external database enrolment to enrol your students on the original site but you don't use that on the target site. You have the option to convert them to manual enrolments.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course restore 'Restore as manual enrolments' option
ResponsesInList.Text: ok, many thanks for clarifying

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Password reset problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Just moving this discussion from the Lounge to Using Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Password reset problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Go to Administration ► Users ► Permissions ► Define roles Then in the roles make sure that can change own password is allowed. Then in Administration ► Security ► Site policies go to the bottom and make sure email change confirmation is set.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What is the most easiest way to embed a server video file?
ResponsesInList.Text: Under Site Administration>Modules>Filters>Manage Filters enable Multimedia Plugins.  Then you just need to link to a file and the movie will paly in Moodle.  FLV movies are best.  Not sure of all formats, but I think most will work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Changing the size of an embedded video, was Re: What is the most easiest way to embed a server video file?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Yuki, You have to look in the HTML and change, for example: <object width=" 480 " height=" 282 " classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" id="videojugplayer"><param name="movie" value="http://www.videojug.com/player?id=637148f3-825e-f062-00cd-ff0008c9d4d8"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.videojug.com/player?id=637148f3-825e-f062-00cd-ff0008c9d4d8" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width=" 480 " height=" 282 " allowFullScreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always"></embed></object> to: <object width=" 240 " height=" 141 " classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" id="videojugplayer"><param name="movie" value="http://www.videojug.com/player?id=637148f3-825e-f062-00cd-ff0008c9d4d8"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.videojug.com/player?id=637148f3-825e-f062-00cd-ff0008c9d4d8" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width=" 240 " height=" 141 " allowFullScreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always"></embed></object> Cheers, Glenys

ResponsesInList.Title: Restarting a course
ResponsesInList.Text: We have a course we have been setting up and designing to use in  Moodle. Now it is ready to go live.  Is there a easy way to "clear" the course of all the testing we did such as forum entries, assignment entries etc. ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restarting a course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Philip, One method is to backup the course and then restore it. During the backup phase you are asked if you want to keep students and course work (forums, assignments, etc).  If you choose not to, only the core information will be used with all student information gone. Hope this helps. Jeff

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restarting a course
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks that works for me.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Paypal Options
ResponsesInList.Text: No. Moodle supports one-time non-recurring payments with fixed price for course enrollments. You can set the enrollment to expire and thus repeat the payment process but the price will remain the same.

ResponsesInList.Title: I need help tracking progress
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Before I get to my questions, let me explain how my instance of moodle is set up. It's for a corporation. There are about 100 short courses, each covering a different topic - how to create a case, how to activate a client, how to read a contract, how to set up your vacation responder, and so on. Each manager has gone through these short courses and chosen the ones they want their employees to take. Analysts might need to take these 20, while account managers take those 18, and support staff take another 35. It's like a buffet, everything's available and people choose what they want. So, first question: is this a crazy way of setting this up? It was the only way I could come up with to not have multiple instances of the same content, but it doesn't seem like the intent of moodle. If anyone has a better way to set up this "buffet line", I'd love to hear it. Second question: what's the best way for students to see all the courses they're in, and their progress in each? I'm using the course meta link for enrollment and (maybe I just don't have it set up right) but I don't see an orderly way to display how many courses they've passed and how many they have left before they complete the meta course. Any recommendations on that front would be awesome.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I need help tracking progress
ResponsesInList.Text: Out of curiosity, are you using the Moodle grade book for each course? Off the top of my head, your approach seems reasonable.  What do you mean by "multiple instances of the same content"?  Quizzes? Assignments? Webpages? If one course is similar to another, Moodle might be great!  Backup the original course (without students), restore it as another course, then edit out what you don't want, add in what is meant to be unique. For your second question, I am not sure.  I don't have this situation.  Again, are you trying to use the grade book for tracking progress?  Have you looked at "activity completion" and allow students to keep track of what they have done (by course)?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I need help tracking progress
ResponsesInList.Text: To clarify "multiple instances of the same content", one of our products is called "inventory". For account managers, they only need to know how to upload , edit, and download inventory. Campaign managers need to know that and basic trouble shooting. Support needs to know all of the above and advanced troubleshooting. My fear in making multiple copies of the course is that, if we change the "best practice" for how to upload, I have to make sure all three instances are updated. Our product and industry change so fast and so often that making sure instance of the information is the same seems unlikely. That's why I want that module thing. Does that clarify things? As for the tracking, I have activity completion turned on and have been using the gradebook. I'm wondering if there's a clear way for the student to see their progress. Like, if they have completed 5 of the 10 required courses, a place they can see they're at 50%.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I need help tracking progress
ResponsesInList.Text: I think your setup is just fine and is a good use of Moodle. If you enroll your participant centrally, after login, they will see only their courses. You configure that through the front page settings. A show all course button will allow them to browse other courses. You can allow self-registration or provide means to request being added to any course. I say that since you seem to imply that people can choose additional courses beyond what their managers have chosen. Moodle does not having true tracking at the site level except for the grading functionality, which does not seem like the right way for you. However, look at the customizable reports. I think that in combination with the completion tracking might provide you with what you need. Look also at the checklist module (for using in individual courses).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I need help tracking progress
ResponsesInList.Text: I've looked at the customizable reports and the learning curve seems extremely steep. I don't doubt the power is there, but do know know of any resources that can help ease that curve?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I need help tracking progress
ResponsesInList.Text: I think your set up looks perfectly reasonable.  I don't know that I'd do meta courses (used to and it was a serious head job) but if you can handle it...go for it.  I set up cohorts and assign the cohorts to the courses.  Add people as they join.  I run a site for a state government agency, so I get the complexity. Now...as for customizable reports...I use the configurable reports plugin.  I did have to learn sql ...but honestly, a one day training (to be fair, I already knew how to write rudimentary Crystal Reports, so that helped and I'd spent a good bunch of time looking at Moodle tables) isn't too bad for being able to design some decent reporting.  And there are some pre-writen reports available that are pretty good.  Most of the reports I use started out as reports available on the Configurable Reports thread.  And you can set them up to only run for the specific individual (transcript) or specific department/groups or all (for you).  I have a my employees report that allows supervisors to view a list of their staff and look at their individual transcripts which is quite popular (you have to assign the supervisor to the employee profile, which might take time but isn't hard).  Technically it is two reports but...it works. Core moodle does have an overview report which will show individual people and all the courses...it is clumsy to get to, though.  Through the grade book and the user must be enrolled.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Gang, Most of my training content is going to be video. From what I see, Moodle is set up to support files and html and other bits of content just fine. I am looking for recommendations for: Plugins or modules that give me the capability to record a presentation, or a screen recorder that can save directly back into Moodle. A way to bulk upload each of my videos and tag them after they've been uploaded. And any other video recommendations people may have. Thank you! Brawta

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video as a large percentage of training content (plugins, modules, )
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to be clear, I am at the very early stages in my setup, so your valuable input at this stage is extremely useful. For background information, I am told that the bulk of the contant in this LMS will be short videos - now and always. I was basically told that a colleague of mine would be going to town on creating video content, while I built the LMS out. Now that they're done creating the videos, it's as if someone plopped down a stack of papers on my desk and said "go file these". Each of the videos can be categorized based on our product lines - which is around 5. I am not a native English speaker, so I am doing my best here with my words. I've set up L,MS's before, but mostly home-grown systems. Moodle is new to me. Along with English. So basically I need to organize these 90 or so videos, and I want to do it in Moodle, and I just want to get some pointers as to the best plugin to use. Hopefully this additional information is helpful for anyone kind enough to help out with a few tips. Thank you, Brawta

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video as a large percentage of training content (plugins, modules, )
ResponsesInList.Text: I think it would be helpful to be specific about how these videos will be laid out and used in your course. That will affect the way you do this. Put it this way, you bulk upload all the videos, what do you expect to see then? If they will just be resources on the course page you could just drag and drop each file into the location you want it to appear in the course page. See here: https://www.oit.umass.edu/support/moodle/about-adding-resources-a-moodle-course If you want them to be just on the server , so that later you can add them to quizzes or other areas of Moodle as you build learning content, then you want to use the File System Repository. You can just upload ( ftp /sftp) to a directory on the server and access the files from within Moodle. http://docs.moodle.org/22/en/File_system_repository There might be an integrated screen capture tool for Moodle, but I am not aware of it. People ask me about it sometimes. Personally I take the screencast using Quicktime or Screencast-o-matic and either upload it to my course , or to YouTube and link to it from there. That workflow may not be so appropriate if you are expecting students to make the screencasts though.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video as a large percentage of training content (plugins, modules, )
ResponsesInList.Text: Justin, thank you for your advices. This is helpful. Hopefully this additional info will help. In the end, what I want to see is a pretty simple page/output. I'd see a listing, perhaps with thumbnails, that list out all the videos available in a given product line. ...something like this: Product 1 [video thumbnail] Getting Started with Product 1 (3 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Intro to Product 1 (4 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Advanced Usage of Product 1 (5 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Conclusion to Product 1 (4 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player Product 2 [video thumbnail] Getting Started with Product 2 (4 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Intro to Product 1 (3 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Advanced Usage of Product 1 (5 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Conclusion to Product 1 (2 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player Product 3 [video thumbnail] Getting Started with Product 3 (4 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Intro to Product 3 (3 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Advanced Usage of Product 3 (5 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player [video thumbnail] Conclusion to Product 3 (2 minutes) <-link to video, plays in an embedded player Does that help explain this more clearly? Thank you, Brawta

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video as a large percentage of training content (plugins, modules, )
ResponsesInList.Text: I see. It is helpful to try to structure your vision in Moodle terms . Either each product = 1 course or There is just a single course, and each product = 1 course section In either case the videos will just be " activities " within a section of the course. You probably should play around with Moodle a bit to get familiar with all that. There are a number of course formats (grid, single topic etc) that you can use to make the layout of a course close to how you want. So check out the course format section of the Moodle plugins database . To embed your videos, here are three ways way 1 Upload and embed the video into a "label" ( under "add activity/resource" when in edit mode.) Sadly, then the video player itself will be right on the course page and there won't be a thumbnail. way 2 Use the label, but just display the thumbnail image in the label , and link it to a separate resource/page( under "add activity/resource" when in edit mode.)  that contains the video. I don't want to overwhelm you with info, so I will leave it there, but later you would need to hide that resource page so it is only accessible via the thumbnail. way 3 Forego the label approach, and just add a resource/page with your video file in it, and in the description area for that page add the thumbnail. Then check the "display description on course page" checkbox. You probably have the most flexibility with way 2, because you could put several thumbnails on one label etc. There are other ways to do all this too, but perhaps you should play around a little and then you will have a better idea of the difference between how it works, and how you want it work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video as a large percentage of training content (plugins, modules, )
ResponsesInList.Text: Wow - Justin that is extremely helpful. I really appreciate you taking the time to answer me. I am going to give this a shot... if I can get my HTML editor to display properly! Thank you SO much. I am diving into this now, but I wanted to first pass my thank you's along. Best, Brawta

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: text on login page
ResponsesInList.Text: If you want to just change the text "Is this your first time here?" then you can use Language Customisation . If you want to change the instructions underneath the heading you can set these under Site administration → Plugins → Authentication → Manage authentication in Instructions .

ResponsesInList.Title: Messaging: Moodle indicates a new message, but message cannot be displayed (1.9.3)
ResponsesInList.Text: One of my users is having an unusual problem with messaging. When she logs in to the system, the messages window pops up as if she has a new message -- but no message is found or displayed within the messaging pop-up. Additionally, on her profile page, the Messages button is displaying as "Messages(1)", but clicking the button displays the same messaging window that she sees when she logs in -- all the features and functions are available, but no new message is displayed. Any suggestions on the cause or resolution of this issue? Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Messaging: Moodle indicates a new message, but message cannot be displayed (1.9.3)
ResponsesInList.Text: I had same problem. It turns out I had accidentally blocked a user who had sent me a message. Since I never read the message, it still indicated that I had an unread message but the user didn't appear on my message window because they were blocked. You can search for users in the message window by clicking on the search tab. I typed in a vowel as my search parameter and then scrolled through my list until I found the user that I had blocked. After I unblocked and read the message things were fine.

ResponsesInList.Title: Room planning
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm looking for a Moodle add-in that will allow me to plan which courses are held in which room at a given time. It should be possible for students and teachers to see where their class is to meet, and it should be possible to check which class is in room 17 next Thursday from 10-11. Also, it should be possible for the planner to handle exceptions, such as: Biology 101 normally meet in room 12 on Wednesdays from 9-10, but the next lesson in held in room 8 on Tuesdag from 11-12. Does such an add-in exist?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Room planning
ResponsesInList.Text: The closest with what you're talking about is the MRBS/Resource Scheduling plug-in . It allows the booking of rooms manually or via import from another system. Existing bookings can be moved, or overridden and automatically re-roomed if required. There's also a "userweek" view which shows the current user's booking for the current week, based on their current enrolments (this requires the booking name to match the course's name, and is easiest to achieve consistently thorough an imported timetable).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Room planning
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Mark, I'll take a look at that.
