ResponsesInList.Title: How to import questions via csv/excel
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Is it possible to import questions via csv or excel in moodle 2.5, if yes please tell me how?? Please please please help Aditya

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to import questions via csv/excel
ResponsesInList.Text: http://docs.moodle.org/26/en/Import_questions (Was very tempted to make that link http://lmgtfy.com/?q=Moodle+import+questions )

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to import questions via csv/excel
ResponsesInList.Text: Tim, There is noting for csv or excel Aditya

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to import questions via csv/excel
ResponsesInList.Text: No, but there are several supported formats, and it is quite possible to re-format the data you currently have in Excel into one of those formats. The glass if half full, if you want it to be.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to import questions via csv/excel
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, there is. Some years ago, I did it in the following way: Look at the list of import formats and the list of export formats. Find some formats that you can both import and export. Create in Moodle 1-3 questions of the type you would like to import. Do not make it too difficult. Choose one type of questions, especially the straightforward onces that might become your big time saver. Export these questions while using the formats identified in item 1. Open the exported files to study their structure. Look for a format that has a clear structure like: <fixed lines of xml text><your question><more xml text><your correct answer><again xml><your first wrong answer><and more xml><your second wrong answer><and again xml>. Select the format that looks most appropriate. You are going to prepare an import file for that format now. Create an excel file with (e.g.) ten columns: reserved for first xml text your question reserved for second xml text your correct answer reserved for third xml text your first wrong answer reserved for fourth xml text your second wrong answer reserved for fifth xml text wait, I will explain below Fill column 2, 4, 6, 8 with your questions and answers. Fill column 1, 3, 5, 7, 9 with the various xml texts (the same on each line) Place a formula in the cells of column 10 that concatenates the texts of all earlier columns, e.g.. =A1&B1&C1&D1 etc., maybe you have to add some spaces her and there as well. Copy the tenth column to a text file (Notepad) Maybe you have to copy some fixed lines at the start and/or at the end from your export example file as well. Import your text file. It sounds like a world trip. However, I had to enter 300 questions. When I did it in the interactive way, I didn't like it anymore after 3 questions. It was so time consuming and boring. Then, I figured out the "world trip" described above. Peace of cake!
role: Picture of Pieter van der Hijden

ResponsesInList.Title: New user login
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm using Moodle 2.0 (Build: 20101125) I would like new users to be able to create an account and register for a course using a key. But the login screen does not present the "Is this your first time here?" that I have in my previous version 1.9.6 (Build: 20091021). BTW that version is still running on the same server , if it makes any difference. TIA tim

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New user login
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tim. It's for security reasons - it stopped being the default a few versions of Moodle 1.9 back. If you want to reset it then go to site admin>plugins>authentication>manage authentication and choose email based self authentication.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New user login
ResponsesInList.Text: OK. Thanks. I enabled Email-based self authentication, but the login page didn't change. Where would a new user go to start the process?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New user login
ResponsesInList.Text: Are you sure that after you have opened the eye of email based self authentication you then scrolled further down the screen to "enable" email based self registration in the dropdown?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New user login
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, that's it. Thank you, Mary and Kristi, for your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New user login
ResponsesInList.Text: There are two parts to setting this up correctly. Enable "Email-based self-registration" under Site Admin -> Users -> Authentication -> Manager authentication This will actually ALLOW this type of registration. You can click the "eye" to make it visible. Common settings (under the table where you just changed the email based self-registration) there is a drop down menu for Self-Registration. This needs to be changed to Email-based self-registration; it is defaulted to disable. This is how the "link" to allow for email registration will be made available on the front page .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle appearance changed when transitioning from http to https
ResponsesInList.Text: As Howard said, if you go to http://yourmoodlesite.org/admin/tool/replace/index.php , you will be able to replace the old URL with the new one. When you're at that page... Enter http://yourmoodlesite.org in the first box. In the second box, enter https://yourmoodlesite.org Tick both the tick boxes Click "Let's do it" Then, if it was me, I would purge all caches. Go to Site Admin > Development > Purge all caches

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle appearance changed when transitioning from http to https
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for these useful details. Yes, for a normal installation of moodle we will probably have to do that but as I said above we use Fortiweb for SSL offloading (in reverse-proxy mode) wich means that Fortiweb acts as the SSL/TLS terminator wich bears the load for encryption processing instead of the web server using the web server's certificate. Therefore from what is written in this page in my case we should only set $ CFG-> sslproxy to 1 in the config.php file and not use SSL because it is Fortiweb that is responsible for encrypting and decrypting with the moodle server certificate that we have to upload in Fortiweb anyway, I will set up this solution and we will see

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle appearance changed when transitioning from http to https
ResponsesInList.Text: My problem is solved. When I disabled the ssl module in the moodle server and I set $CFG->sslproxy to 1 In the config.php file the moodle site was accessible in https but its appearance changed. Then what I did I activated the ssl module and I allowed secure connections to the login page by checking the box "Use HTTPS for logins" in the "HTTP security" page and I also changed http:// to https:// in $CFG->wwwroot the result is the site has regained its normal appearance with https . I didn't have to use this link: http://yourmoodlesite.org/admin/tool/replace/index.php I have only manually modified four unsecured links that the former administrator added to customize the homepage

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle appearance changed when transitioning from http to https
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I had to use this script (mymoodle.com/admin/tool/replace/index.php) this morning, because while browsing some courses, their link were in https but it shows me the yellow padlock telling me that the connection Is not secure and that some parts of the page are not secure such as the images, indeed, I copied the url of these images and I found that they were in http, so I used this script and it's ok now. I do not understand why, I had to do all this, we have Fortiweb which is configured to make SSL offloading ie the moodle server does not use its own server certificate. Instead, FortiWeb acts like an SSL proxy for the web server, possessing the web server’s certificate and using it to: authenticate itself to clients decrypt requests encrypt responses and according to this doc I will only have to put $ CFG-> sslproxy to 1 and not use ssl in the moodle server . anyway, I do not master Fortiweb at all, I am discovering it, maybe I have misconfigured or I have not configured some things, or this document does not apply to my version of Moodle (3.0) Thank you all for your help

ResponsesInList.Title: Profile fields on first logon, and initial email
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, This is my first post, and I'm fairly new to Moodle (although I am a PHP dev), so please bare with me. I've just installed Moodle 2.9 on our internal server , hooked it up to Active Directory, installed a theme, created a course and so on fine. I've just tried to log on with an Active Directory student account and noticed a couple of undesirable things: 1. User profile settings on initial logon How can we bypass the initial profile update screen on a users first logon? We don't want any user editing any of their profile information. This moodle installation is going to be strictly for courses, nothing social. In addition, we definitely don't want students to have the power to update their own name. We only want network administrators to be able to edit user information, so keep it consistant across all our systems. 2. Email Addresses are required Why are email addresses required? We don't want students to be able to enter personal email addresses, and the don't have school emails (yet). Staff do have emails, but again, we don't want them to be able to change them themselves. How can I stop users being able to edit the email field 3. Sending emails on initial logon Again, we don't want emails be sent by moodle to any user. Even if they forget their password, or username or whatever. If they need a password reset, they contact the network admins. If they have an issue with a course, they can contact their teachers directly. There is absolutely no need (from what I can see) for Moodle to be sending out emails. Again, how can we disable this feature. Thanks for your time. Phil

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Profile fields on first logon, and initial email
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Phil, we are using Shibboleth so I'm not sure if what I'm suggesting works also with Active Directory. 1) You should try to match all the required fields. For the example in a previous versione Moodle the city was required. So we used a default value to avoid the initial profile update screen. 2) In the setting page of Shibboleth we can choose what field users can change. Using Moodle without requiring an email is not easy. You can find some ideas in this discussion: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=305667 Bye Sara

ResponsesInList.Title: Anyone share experience of using Vimeo to host video?
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm looking to use Vimeo (probably Vimeo Plus) to host video that are embedded in Moodle. Any thoughts?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anyone share experience of using Vimeo to host video?
ResponsesInList.Text: We use Vimeo Plus and have had no issues embedding in Moodle (1.9 or 2.0) - that is once I figured out how to embed. I have never used a different host, so I have nothing to compare it with, but it seems to be working great for us.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anyone share experience of using Vimeo to host video?
ResponsesInList.Text: Cool that's wanted to hear!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anyone share experience of using Vimeo to host video?
ResponsesInList.Text: Sue, Have you used plain Vanilla Vimeo? Are you using the stock standard embedd approach as detailed here: http://vimeo.com/help/faq#other_site - Or are you doing a small tweak as well? How do you do it?? add a page > switch to HTML > add embed code or is it a little different? -Derek

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anyone share experience of using Vimeo to host video?
ResponsesInList.Text: We use Vimeo Plus, although that decision was made before I arrived, I believe it has something to do with the number of videos we can upload in a week. Once they videos are uploaded, we copy both the URL and embed code. In Moodle we create a page, hit enter a few times and create a hyperlink with the e the URL, then go to the HTML and paste the embed code. We provide both the URL and embed code for redundancy in case one does not work. It also works best to copy and paste all of the links to a Word document first so you are not going back and forth between Vimeo and Moodle. We also utilize the Desktop Uploader tool. It makes things alot easier when we have several videos to post. HTH

ResponsesInList.Title: Course and Role Id's only in odd numbers (skipping even numbers)
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle 3.1.1+ Hi all, we are encountering a very strange issue with moodle. Upon installing moodle on our server , we noticed that Course and Role Id's are listed as 1,3,5,7, etc. Eg. Manager roleid=1, Course creator roleid=3, Teacher roleid=5, etc. When we create a new course or role, it takes the next 'odd' number. Does anyone know what is causing this and how to fix it? Our host uses MySQL , not My SQL i, if that makes any difference. Tried installing moodle with MySQLi and mariaDB , both encounters the same issue. Any help would be very much appreciated!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course and Role Id's only in odd numbers (skipping even numbers)
ResponsesInList.Text: Are you by chance using a clustered or replicated database backend? The first thing that came to mind is the mariadb/mysql "auto increment offset" setting: https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/replication-and-binary-log-server-system-variables/#auto_increment_offset I don't recommend that for Moodle. I have heard of that being enabled by default in some setups. You could confirm this by looking at some other tables and see if the id field have incremental ids or if they are also all "odd"

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course and Role Id's only in odd numbers (skipping even numbers)
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, speaking to others we think it is due to our database's default auto increment, but haven't had time to look into that yet. I believe it's auto_increment_increment that needs changing, as compared to auto_increment_offset. You don't recommend changing that? The other id's (such as courses) are all "odd" as well, so as you say it's most likely the reason. Thanks for your reply!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course and Role Id's only in odd numbers (skipping even numbers)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Chye. Yes I agree, it does seem that the auto_increment_increment is the one causing this. If you are using master-master database, the two settings we are discussing cannot probably be changed. It has been a while since I've looked closely at this, but I do not think Moodle supports Master-Master database setup. In fact it broke Moodle on older versions a few years ago when master-master db is used, and more than one front-end web application servers are accessing two different databases. If you are using Moodle with master-master databases in this way, you probably cannot safely change the increment settings. To this point, it is also highly dependent on what type of replication is being used between the two databases. At this point I would recommend some caution. Find out if you are using a master-master db setup, where both master databases are being used simultaneously. I think it is important to understand this before making any changes. Also a database backup will be very important to have before making changes. The reason I am advising so much caution is because the id numbers are so critical to Moodle. If you are not using multiple databases with master-master, and it is currently working fine, perhaps no change is needed. Though based on my experiences from a few years ago, I don't recommend using auto_increment_increment. If you have a "young" site that is not in production, or just in "testing/evaluation" phase, then perhaps starting with a clean slate, a fresh install, is in order. My worry is that continuing as-is may end up with irreversible and unrecoverable damage to the db. Again this all depends on: if you are actually using a master-master setup, if both masters are being used simultaneously, what replication engine is being used, Moodle version, plugins that may behave differently, and probably more considerations. I would like to find more recent information on Moodle and auto_increment_increment. I did a quick search and didn't find what I was looking for, something more from a very technical developer perspective.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle site loads very slowly after being accessed through server

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A Big problem with videos on production server
ResponsesInList.Text: 2 things I can think of off the top of my head. This first one is a bit of a long shot but cCould it be something to do with the non standard port you are using? Also, could it be anything to do with the following bug related to Firefox not passing session cookies to WMP... http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-15642 Also, the above video will not play because the video requires you to log in first.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A Big problem with videos on production server
ResponsesInList.Text: Unless it's an intranet and you have full control the non-standard port is a properly bad idea. If that's not causing this problem it will catch up with you in the end. Carefully check your web server settings for any restrictions. Check if you have an htaccess file that may be affecting things. Is there are firewall of any description that might be affecting things.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A Big problem with videos on production server
ResponsesInList.Text:
```text
I had the same problem so I did a diff on the page source for
these mplayer options:

1. Type = video, file = <path to file>
2. Type = full url, file = <mplayer path><path to file>

The difference was that option 1. included 'provider=video&' inside
'<param name="flashvars" ...' So, in mod/mplayer/lib.php I changed line 527 from:

if($mplayer->type != '')

to:

if($mplayer->type != '' && $mplayer->type != 'video')

and now it works
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A Big problem with videos on production server
ResponsesInList.Text:
```text
UPDATE:

My fix only worked because the wrong file type was being used with the setting type=video.

If the provider parameter is not set, then the player detects it.

When the type=full url method is used, the provider parameter is not set.
In this case, an unsupported video format will hang in mplayer,
with the progress bar showing instead of the misleading error message.
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: animated gifs in profile images
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, From my understanding, when you upload a profile picture of any sort (animated or not), php and gd between them compress the image, resize it to 100x100 (and a smaller version as well), then discard the original. So, as far as I can make out, your animated gif will be no more, and all that will be left is two highly compressed jpeg versions of it, one 35x35 and the other 100x100. Matthew

ResponsesInList.Title: /var/moodledata/temp and size issues
ResponsesInList.Text: Good Morning, We are running Moodle 2.8.1 on Ubuntu Server 14.10 We had a Denial of Service attack last night and one of the "victims" appears to be Moodle with something weird having happened to available disk space = i.e. there is none. I've managed to get the server running again by deleting a few files, but the database restart gives this error: Incorrect key file for table '/tmp/# sql _ba4_0.MYI'; try to repair it I can now log back into Moodle BUT the forums site news does not load. I've placed the site into maintenance mode whilst we try figure out what is going on here. I've looked at the various forums and  I suspect this is all related to lack of disk space which we are working on. I'm curious though as to what has taken all the space - could there have been some sort of injection attack as part of the DoS that has blown out the mySQL database size. Rather than speculate too much, I've got some hard and fast questions that would be useful for some advice of possible: My /var/moodledata/ directory is 120GB - this is largely made of video files from one dance teacher that uploaded them into Moodle directly rather thanusing a video streaming site like YouTube. I have her migrating these videos to ETV.org.nz which will then be embedded rather than hosted on our server. If I delete her course will it delete the associated video files in Moodle or will it leave them in her personal repository? Is it possible to directly delete content within /var/moodledata/ ? The /var/moodledata/temp directory is around 16GB - can I manually flush this, or does that impact on Moodle's performance? Any easy ways to tell the size of the mySQL database directly? Any help with this would be greatly appreciated Regards, Sam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: /var/moodledata/temp and size issues
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a break down of our storage: --- /var ----------------------------------------------------------------------- 195.3GiB [##########] /moodledata 1.6GiB [          ] /lib 929.8MiB [          ] /mail 395.8MiB [          ] /www 248.1MiB [          ] /log 227.8MiB [          ] /cache 20.9MiB [          ] /crash 1.7MiB [          ] /backups 100.0KiB [          ] /spool e   4.0KiB [          ] /tmp e   4.0KiB [          ] /opt e   4.0KiB [          ] /metrics e   4.0KiB [          ] /local @   0.0  B [          ]  lock @   0.0  B [          ]  run and in the actual /var/moodledata/ directory --- /var/moodledata ------------------------------------------------------------ /.. 175.9GiB [##########] /filedir 17.6GiB [#         ] /temp 1.7GiB [          ] /trashdir 74.2MiB [          ] /cache 15.3MiB [          ] /localcache 156.0KiB [          ] /lock 48.0KiB [          ] /lang 16.0KiB [          ]  perspective.temp 16.0KiB [          ] /muc e   4.0KiB [          ] /filter 4.0KiB [          ]  .htaccess It would be nice if we could cull that temp directory - is there any damage to Moodle if we manually delete that? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: /var/moodledata/temp and size issues
ResponsesInList.Text: Advise investigating /moodledata/temp/ first.   Reason:  if something is broke related to temp folder usage it will just build back up again.    What does that contain ... a ls -lR would be nice. The 'bloat' there could be a result of failed backups (found in /moodledata/temp/backup/) ... do you have automated backups set up?  Are they completing ... or are they failing due to lack of space?  Might have to turn off auto backups. If desparate for space, can remove all files/folders in moodledata/temp/backup/ without consequences.  But would watch it. The 'trashdir' looks as if cron job hasn't emptied the trash ... that would free up 1.7 Gig. From the command line, run the cron job serveral times: cd /path_to_moodlecode/admin/cli/ php cron.php How often are you running cron job? After running cron several times, check the trashdir and size/contents of temp What's contained in 'crash'? Any .crash files in there? 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User fields not populating from AD
ResponsesInList.Text: Got command line access to the 3.2 moodle?  IF so, there is a command line only php script in moodlecode/auth/ldap/cli/ called sync_users.php. Make a backup of DB before using. Comments in the header of that script for version 3.2.2: * Notes: *   - it is required to use the web server account when executing PHP CLI scripts *   - you need to change the "www-data" to match the apache user account *   - use "su" if "sudo" not available *   - If you have a large number of users, you may want to raise the memory limits *     by passing -d momory_limit=256M *   - For debugging & better logging, you are encouraged to use in the command line: *     -d log_errors=1 -d error_reporting=E_ALL -d display_errors=0 -d html_errors=0 *   - If you have a large number of users, you may want to raise the memory limits *     by passing -d momory_limit=256M It takes settings from config of Moodle and as you can see, it has options for debugging and better logging.  They also warn that it could take a long time ... depending. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Preventing downloads

How can I place the exemplar letters in an area where they can be seen - but never downloaded by other students. I realise one option is to scan the letters in as picture files but many have been uploaded as text files.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Preventing downloads
ResponsesInList.Text: You could add them as Moodle webpages (add a resource>compose a webpage) - with an enormous caveat re formatting etc etc you could copy and paste the contents of the letter into said webpage. But to be honest they could still screenshot an image or a webpage so if they were determined to copy something, they would.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Preventing downloads
ResponsesInList.Text: If you put something on the Internet there is absolutely NO way of stopping people downloading that information. every single website (pretty much) is downloaded to your computer as a cache when ever you visit it... In short - if you do not want people to be able to copy it; don't put it online! Jon

Background: We have several courses (12 weeks long) that contain multiple embedded videos ~10 videos.  I have been placing the videos in the course via inserting a new label (view HTML) , and then copy/pasting the embed code from various - usually youtube. Typical code looks like this: <iframe title="YouTube video player" width="640" height="390" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/2uJN3Z1ryck" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe> or <iframe src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/lVzMhwwAO74" width="480" height="390" frameborder="0"></iframe> These videos display/play great in the courses. The issue: When loading the course page in any browser (with all 12 weeks visible), the page will take much longer to load (5-10 seconds) if the videos are embedded, compared to the same course with no videos (loads under a second).  While this 5-10 second load is occurring I can see the browser progress hanging on getting the video content from youtube or wherever. So the issue is one of the Moodle page (or the browser) waiting to get certain content before loading the rest of the page.  Is there anyway to code/tell Moodle to simultaneaous load these items rather than wait for video1, before going to video 2......etc.etc. Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Del user from course in profile is it exist?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello ALL. IS it exist plugin  which can help to delete user from course on fis profile page? I open his profile and in list of his courses i may click for delete user from couses... Teacher said me that it was in moodle 1.9, but now he can not do this. moodle 2.8.3 Thanks, Serg.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Del user from course in profile is it exist?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Serg, users can be deleted from courses, but they are not deleted from the Moodle. The profile pages are activated from inside the Moodle not from within the course page. You can, AFAIK , only delete users from the Moodle by removing them manually from the database . The problem is that you always miss something. This causes orphan records, or part records, and will likely crash your database eventually, if there are enough orphan strings or part records. The idea is you can remove a student from a course but if the student retakes that course, they have access to work they have already completed.

ResponsesInList.Title: IMS/CP viewer and iOS
ResponsesInList.Text: iOS devices (iPhone, iPad) currently cannot display the contents of an IMS/CP package in a scrollable way, i.e. the top of the contents is visible, but you cannot scroll down in the viewer's sub-window. Other sources cite similar problems with iOS when trying to view <iframe> contents - they're not scrollable. I suspect that the same underlying problem is responsible for both cases, even though the IMS/CP viewer uses an <object> to display the contents. Does anyone have more information on this issue, or even a workaround?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Plugins Site Not Reachable.
ResponsesInList.Text: Firstly, when checking for available updates, your Moodle site is fetching data from https://download.moodle.org/api/1.3/updates.php and not from the Plugins directory. But Moodle community servers do not return the 403 HTTP status. I believe it is a restriction of your hosting provider .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Plugins Site Not Reachable.

Is it possible to set this up without having to copy an acitvity/section/course for each class? I can do it by copying the course for each class but that implies a lot of site management once something changes in the course contents. We are running Moddle 2.6. Any direction is very much appreciated

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assigning different due dates for different classes in one course
ResponsesInList.Text: Is a Meta-Course with childcourses my answer?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Assigning different due dates for different classes in one course
ResponsesInList.Text: I have courses starting up to 6 times a year. Most are not very complicated courses (some assignments, some resources, some quizzes, some forums). We create a new course for each start date and, often, multiple versions of the same course taught by different teachers. Since resources such as docs, pdfs, videos are all on a non-Moodle repository, making a change to a resource works to change it in the courses and/or copies of courses because all use the same link. Just replace the old file or whatever with something identically named. We don't find the need to make many changes in Moodle courses, but when we do, they are usually easy to do, taking only a couple of hours *at the most.* We enroll between 437 and a little under 400 per start date.

ResponsesInList.Title: Please answer ONE question - questions for a college project
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I am looking for someone in K-12 Moodling that can talk about program implementation, converting courses from face-to-face to online, accessibility issues, etc. I promise that it will be very short and can be via email. this interview is an assignment for the Master's program in Online Teaching and Learning at California State University-East Bay. They use Blackboard, but I am using Moodle for special needs students for my capstone project. So . . . I'm turning to my fellow K-12 Moodlers for help! So is anybody out there, with all the free time they have as educators, willing to answer some questions for me? I have been using Moodle for almost eight years. Let me know by reply, as I need to have this done in the next week and a half. Here are some of the questions I would ask: 1. How long has your online program used Moodle, did you switch from another CMS? If so, why did you switch to Moodle? 2. Is your program a major transfer of classes from facd-to-face to online? If so, how did you train traditional classroom teachers to transfer their classes to online. 3. Do you have official professional development courses to train teachers on how to use Moodle, transfer courses, give tech support? If so, do you hold face-to-face workshops or do you use Moodle? 4. What kind of tech support is available at your institution? In your opinion, is it effective for the teachers? For the students? 5. How involved are your parents involved in your online learning program? Do you have parent accounts? 6. How do you ensure that your courses are as accessible as possible for disabled students? Do you follow Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)? 7. How do you host your online program? If hosted locally, do you have proper server space, memory, and broadband access for your online program? Who is in charge of the server? 8. How do you assess the effectiveness of a particular course? The entire program? 9. What is the workload of an online instructor vs. a traditional face-to-face instructor? Do they receive more or less compensation? Is tenure affected by whether an instructor teaches online or not? 10. Do you have a blended or online only program? 11. Are your courses using media-rich content? If not, why? If so, do you have problems with compatibility? 12. Do you integrate third party Web 2.0 tools in your program? If not, why? 13. Who owns the course content in your program, the institution or the instructor? 14. How does your institution monitor fair-use, plagiarism and copyright infringement. 15. What provisions/accommodations do you make for LD students? Sincerely, Jamey Barber jbarbercsueb@gmail.com

ResponsesInList.Title: User Password Updated After First Login - Moodle 3.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello. I am using Moodle version 3.1 on a server with Linux 4.9.51, and our users are reporting that after setting their password and logging in for the first time, upon the next login their password has changed and they are unable to log in. When I check the report logs, I can see the following message for each user after their first login: "The user with id X changed the password of the user with id Y" The origin for this log entry is "cli", and these entries tend to occur in bulk at the same time, always on times ending on some multiple of "15", leading me to believe that it is a scheduled task that is updating user passwords after their first login, preventing them from logging in again. We upload users in bulk and create password and send via email, but do not force password change. I am wondering how to disable the user password update after their first login? I am having trouble narrowing it down to what is causing this, even if I suspect it is caused by a scheduled task.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Password Updated After First Login - Moodle 3.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Find out who is user 'X' first.  Is that user assigned an Admin level or is that user in a custom role that has related capabilities. You can check all task ... yoursite/admin/tool/task/scheduledtasks.php Check the ones related to users/accounts. They show a time to run/how often ... do those setting match what you see in logs? 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Password Updated After First Login - Moodle 3.1
ResponsesInList.Text: User 'X' in this case is user with id '19', one of our admin users. I see them as not only performing user password updates, but sending out the automated emails about Moodle updates when I review the logs. I have checked our scheduled tasks, but the last run time for the ones related to the users/accounts and passwords all match the logs, or else are more recent than the logs, for last runtime, and their Next Run is scheduled as "ASAP", even though it has been over four days since the last run for all of them. For reference, the last incident I see in my logs of a user password update is 2/4 at 12:00 am, which is the last run time for about half of my scheduled tasks. I also do not know if a scheduled task could have run more recently than that time and simply not found any new users to update the passwords of, in which case it would not register in the logs. Checking those that are scheduled to run on 15 minute increments, the only one that matches the criteria of both having run at or more recently than the last incident of password reset and acting on 15 minute intervals is "Global search index optimization", which does not sound like the likely culprit from the name alone. For reference, these are the scheduled tasks that sound relevant to users/accounts that I see that have run at, or more recently than the last incident of a user password update: - Send New user Passwords - Send Failed Login Notifications - Cleanup Password Reset Attempts The full list is much longer and includes scheduled tasks that from their descriptions don't sound like they are the cause of the problem, such as "Background processing for caches". Poking through the back end, I have also begun to try to follow instances where user_password_updated.php is called, which is the source of the message that appears in the logs, to try to see if I can find out what might be calling it for this particular issue, though I haven't had success with this so far.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to embed video file with size larger than 16MB in Moodle 2
ResponsesInList.Text: I have some video files I want to embed into my course in moodle 2.0, but each time I try to add the files, moodle says the files are ''This file is bigger than the maximum size''. I have use the ftp copy the files into the respositories folder. Am I doing something wrong?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to embed video file with size larger than 16MB in Moodle 2
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, I came across the same issue. Here's how I managed: Go to Site Administration » Security » Site Policies and check if the max. size for file upload reads: ' Server Limit'. Check your host for the maximum of Mb's to be uploaded. Mine allows a max of 64 Mb. You need to change the php.ini file in order for the system to accept larger files. If you can't find it request your host to make it available to you. Look for this string in php.ini: 
```text
; Maximum size of POST data that PHP will accept.


post_max_size = ##M


 where ## presents your current max size
```
 Apply the changes and save the file. Copy this file into ALL the subdirectories of your moodle. Once done you can upload larger files. Hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to embed video file with size larger than 16MB in Moodle 2
ResponsesInList.Text: Copy this file into ALL the subdirectories of your moodle. Should only have to do that in PHP4. See "Using PHP" here for help in using custom php.ini files and copying/deleting/tidying up if required.

ResponsesInList.Title: moodle 2.3 - Getting to grips with tracking
ResponsesInList.Text: hi all, we have our first course completed and have nearly 400 staff to use it and complete it by the end of the year. We have LDAP turned on so all our staff in Active Directory can log in with their company email usernames and passwords. So far, about 50 people have logged in and I can see them as users. I presume I cant tell who hasnt logged in except by crosschecking a printout of moodle users against a printout of active directory users. We have completion tracking turned on etc. But a few people tell me they dont have the button in the final feedback topic to send feedback which would complete the course. And in the reports section, only 4 staff names appear but i can see about 50 in the users tab. Any suggestions? Brian.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle 2.3 - Getting to grips with tracking
ResponsesInList.Text: If you look at course admin>users>enrolled users what roles do they have?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle 2.3 - Getting to grips with tracking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi in that section only 4 users appear, 3 of which are admins. And the only role that it says is Student role. I wonder why the other 50 or so staff that have logged in to do the course dont appear in this section.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle 2.3 - Getting to grips with tracking
ResponsesInList.Text: SOLVED: I turned off guest access to the course. then a staff member phoned me to say they got a message saying they must enrol in the course to do it. then i realised that the students werent enrolled at all but were doing the course as guests but as valid users as they were made users via LDAP. I had manual enrollments int he settings ticked, so I went and made self enrollment an option and now each new student must enrol first and they appear in the course completion settings. Luckily all who made progress in the course had their progress saved so when they next entered the course they were forced to enrol first whcih brought their progress along with them into the course completion tab. all worked out fine.

ResponsesInList.Title: SQL Report to list all users enrolled in a course but have not accessed it
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I have been using one of the ad-hoc contributed reports to identify all users that are enrolled in a course but have not yet accessed the course (i.e. started it).  The report is "Enrolled users,which did not login into the Course, even once (Moodle 2)" . What I recently found is that if a user is enrolled in multiple courses and has accessed at least 1 of them, that user will not show up in this report.  From what I can tell it is because of the test for "u l . timeaccess IS NULL "(where ul is prefix_user_lastaccess .  So in reality this is limiting it to only users that have never logged in. Does anyone have an idea as to how to change this query so that it checks if an enrolled user has actually started a course versus logging into the system? Below is the query from the documentation. SELECT user2 . id AS ID , ul . timeaccess , user2 . firstname AS Firstname , user2 . lastname AS Lastname , user2 . email AS Email , user2 . city AS City , user2 . idnumber AS IDNumber , user2 . phone1 AS Phone , user2 . institution AS Institution , IF ( user2 . lastaccess = 0 , 'never' , DATE_FORMAT ( FROM_UNIXTIME ( user2 . lastaccess ) , '%Y-%m-%d' ) ) AS dLastAccess

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL Report to list all users enrolled in a course but have not accessed it
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe I found the solution and would appreciate someone else verifying before updating the documentation.  Please note: I removed the constraint to just one course and have it displaying results for all courses. SELECT user2 . id AS ID , user2 . firstname AS Firstname , user2 . lastname AS Lastname , user2 . email AS Email , user2 . city AS City , user2 . idnumber AS IDNumber , user2 . phone1 AS Phone , user2 . institution AS Institution , IF ( user2 . lastaccess = 0 , 'never' , DATE_FORMAT ( FROM_UNIXTIME ( user2 . lastaccess ) , '%Y-%m-%d' ) ) AS dLastAccess ,c.fullname AS Coursename , ( SELECT DATE_FORMAT ( FROM_UNIXTIME ( timeaccess ) , '%Y-%m-%d' ) FROM prefix_user_lastaccess WHERE userid = user2 . id AND courseid = c . id ) AS CourseLastAccess , ( SELECT r . name FROM prefix_user_enrolments AS uenrol JOIN prefix_enrol AS e ON e . id = uenrol . enrolid JOIN prefix_ role AS r ON e . id = r . id WHERE uenrol . userid = user2 . id AND e . courseid = c . id ) AS RoleName FROM prefix_user_enrolments AS ue JOIN prefix_enrol AS e ON e . id = ue . enrolid JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c . id = e . courseid JOIN prefix_user AS user2 ON user2 . id = ue . userid WHERE ( SELECT timeaccess FROM prefix_user_lastaccess WHERE userid = user2 . id AND courseid = c . id ) IS NULL

ResponsesInList.Title: /moodle question
ResponsesInList.Text: i've seen that alot of regiterd sites ends with /moodle while some not is there any differences ? also in the setup guide i saw " If you are going to test the installation on the internet, then you will need to put the public ip address followed by a forward slash and moodle: your_ip_address/moodle or you can put your domain name here instead.  " can any one clarify to me the different and why some sites ends with /moodle ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: /moodle question
ResponsesInList.Text: No difference it's simply a mater of how Moodle is installed on your server . If it lives in the 'document root' (as specified in the web server configuration) then it will not have /anything at the end. If it is located in a subdirectory then it will. Do note that it can be located anywhere... you can have things like: http://www.mysite.com/vle http://learning.mysite.com/ Anything really! You need to understand how to configure these things for your chosen web server though.

ResponsesInList.Title: RSS feeds to external site
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. The moodle allows RSS feeds from other sites. into the Moodle. is the reversed direction possible? one of our clients would like to have RSS feeds of changes in the Moodle (new courses, for example), to appear in another site as an RSS feed. the client uses version 2.2.4. Is there a working plug-in for such a request? I couldn't find any in the forums. Thanks, Ilan.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: RSS feeds to external site
ResponsesInList.Text: Ilan You can set up a Moodle forum or blog (or database or glossary) to act as an RSS feed. You could do this on your Moodle home page or perhaps in a dedicated course for your local Moodle News. That way, you can add details of changes in your Moodle, new courses etc as forum/blog postings which can be fed out to other RSS clients (e.g. desktop RSS clients, other websites, Mahara e-portfolio, even RSS client blocks elsewhere in Moodle). In order to make use of RSS feeds produced by Moodle, they need to be enabled by an administrator. Enable RSS feeds for the site in Settings > Site administration > Advanced features Enable RSS feeds for database activities , forums and/or glossaries in Settings > Site administration > Plugins > Activity modules In the settings for the individual activity you can then select the number of entries you would like included in the RSS feed. See http://docs.moodle.org/26/en/Category:RSS for more details on RSS feeds in Moodle. Hope that helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Colors used in calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I'm using the theme "Fusion" and I'm looking for the page that contains the colorsettings that are used in the calendar for different event types (group, sitewide,user, course). Can anyone point me in the right direction? Thanks in advance, Pieter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Colours used in calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Three changes are required for this.  Colours are set in base and canvas so we need to override them in your theme. 1) Add the following lines to theme/fusion/style/core. css .calendartable .duration_user ul { border-color: #dce7ec; } .calendartable .duration_global ul { border-color: #d6f8cd; } .calendartable .duration_group ul { border-color: #fee7ae; } .calendartable .duration_course ul { border-color: #ffd3bd; } .minicalendar .calendar_event_user, .minicalendar .duration_user { border-color: #dce7ec; } .minicalendar .calendar_event_course, .minicalendar .duration_course { .minicalendar .calendar_event_global, .minicalendar .duration_global { border-color: #d6f8cd; } .minicalendar .calendar_event_group, .minicalendar .duration_group { border-color: #fee7ae; } 2) Edit theme/fusion/config.php and add the extra line as below: $THEME->sheets = array( 'core', 'pagelayout', 'menus', 'settings', 'calendar', ); 3) Now create a file theme/fusion/style/calendar.css and add the following four lines to it. .calendar_event_course {background-color:#FFD3BD;} .calendar_event_global {background-color:#D6F8CD;} .calendar_event_group {background-color:#FEE7AE;} .calendar_event_user {background-color:#DCE7EC;} Don't forget to change the colours or you won't see any difference! Hope this helps George

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Colours used in calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks George, I followed your idea and have applied the changes you described but the colors won't change. In the folder theme/fusion/style I noticed a file settings.css. But after opening it only the following code is added: a { color: setting:linkcolor ; } /** Custom CSS **/ setting:customcss Could it be that that changes have to be applied to the file <customcss> and if so, where is that file located? In the theme folder or in the root? Hope to hearing from you soon and thanks again. Pieter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Colours used in calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Pieter, I only discovered the settings myself yesterday shortly before posting and have improved the way I made the changes.  It works on Moodle 2.0 - make sure that you have enabled theme designer mode or you won't see changes. I have now put everything into one calendar.css file (attached) so that all the settings are together.  The only other change needed is to fusion/config.php where you add to line 61 (in this case) that you're using calendar.css. To make it even easier for you, I've attached the two files as a zip file that have the changes for the fusion theme. Sorry about the terrible colours that come out - our corporate colours that I'm stuck with - but hopefully it will get you started. Just remember this is for moodle 2.0 and theme designer mode must be on at least until you set the colours to what you want. Regards George

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Colours used in calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Have mercy on this newbe, I indeed forgot to turn designer mode on. Once done the changes appeared. Thanks very much George, working with Moodle seems to get even better with this kind of help. Pieter

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle as provider to Universities
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm using Moodle 2.9+ (Latest as of now). I'm trying to develop a portal where more than one university will be involved and enrollments are going on the basis of those universities. Here the basic idea is to categorize Moodle users with its University. Following are my questions, requirements and research. University A has 50 users (Students). Manager of University A can create course and all 50 members (students) will be automatically enrolled in that course. I took a deep look at Moodle LMS and found the "Cohorts" section which can do this part with "Cohort Sync" enrollment method. University A and University B have to pay certain amount to site owner (No Payment Integration needed just a database field with cohort ID and rate would work). I may need to create a local plugin to extend Moodle. (Any other way would be appreciated.) How do I assign roles based on Cohort (University)? For e.g. University A Manager will have full authority to create course, adding students, initiate forums but University A Manager should not have permission to view/edit/delete University B Manager's section. Please note that, University is nothing but Cohort in Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: upgrade fault sessions table
ResponsesInList.Text: I am trying to upgrade from 2.4.1 to 2.6 but have a problem Previously the system had login issues which were resolved by adding in the line: $CFG->dbsessions = '0'; When I try to upgrade the sessions table is missing from the moodle mySQL database and the error message is: Table "sessions" does not exist When looking in the Database there is no table called sessions. What should I do next. The moodle 2.4.1 is working fine but the new verion will not upgrade?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upgrade fault sessions table
ResponsesInList.Text: First ... as a standard practice, make sure you have a full site backup ... code directory, data directory, and an SQL dump of the DB. Never had the issue ... but you might try this ... In your current site, edit config.php and comment out the dbsessions line by placing // in front of it.   That puts your site back to using the DB for session recording/information.   Should not have to restart any service. Then attempt to login to make sure you can login.    If you can login - no errors related to DB - then double check the DB to make sure there is a mdl_sessions table.  Skip next and go to * below. If there are errors - ie, you can't login, we need to see why!  Switch back to no dbsessions - un-comment the dbsession line.   Login.   Turn on Debugging.   Logout.   Re-edit config.php and try to login. If Moodle has any complaints or errors  come beck here to share what they were.  Please add additional information concerning your site:  remotely hosted?  what provider?  or if locally hosted, what OS?  You might be able to find a clue in server logs ... php, apache, mysql. * Do the upgrade. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upgrade fault sessions table
ResponsesInList.Text: OK I am not doing this on the production site as there is to much to risk. I have used the backup and configure to create a local system (all works ok). I have done // and the problem of login in comes back (you cannot log in) and no table is created. My gut feeling is I need import a blank table 'sessions' and the upgrade will fix the problem. But how do I get one in the MySQL.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upgrade fault sessions table
ResponsesInList.Text: When you disabled sessions via DB, was a 'sessions' directory created in moodledata?   Were you able to login then? What are permissions of the DB user for Moodle?  Does the DB user have full access rights ... ie, be able to create a new table? https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/show-grants.html On the production server: mysqldump -u username -p databasename mdl_sessions > path/mdl_sessions.sql then on dev server: mysql -u username -p  databasename  < path/mdl_sessions.sql 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upgrade fault sessions table
ResponsesInList.Text: Still no success The sessions table in the database is missing. I have inserted a blank sessions table in the database with correct fields from a blank  moodle installation the upgrade now errors: coding error detected must be fixed by programmer. the moodle is locally hosted on a linux ubuntu server. Have accessed Mysql and ask it to fix problems with database (no errors) Still no joy same problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upgrade fault sessions table
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok, you have a copy (sql dump,data directory, config.php file)  of your production server on a Linux Ubuntu development box, right?   How are you downloading the sql dump of the production database? ... raw .sql file or are you tar balling that .sql dump file first, then downloading the tar ball? How are you acquiring the code?   The 'old way' or git ?  This assumes that the development box has the required versions of PHP/MySQL for version 2.6+ and beyond. Suggest using git.   For the new code directory one can set the branch to 2.4.x - which means the copy of the site would go through a minor within series upgrade.   Use the edited config.php file for the dev. box. Now before you begin, do you have any add-ons in the currently active 2.4.x on the production server?  How about themes?   If you do, acquire a 2.4.x version of those (the .zip files) and manually unzip them in their appropriate locations on the dev box. Moodle at document root of Ubuntu ... directory is /var/www (correct)?  Note the ownships/permissions on www directory. git clone git://git.moodle.org/moodle.git www cd www git branch -a git branch --track MOODLE_24_STABLE origin/MOODLE_24_STABLE git checkout MOODLE_24_STABLE Do the actual upgrade via command line ... cd gitacquiredmoodlecode/admin/cli/  php upgrade.php Once the that site has been upgraded to 2.4.x highest (and checked out for functionality), step it through an upgrade to 2.5.x, then to 2.6.x, but before you do, make a site backup locally - db dump, archive of code directory is minimal. Site is now functioning 2.4.x - to upgrade it via git: cd moodlecodedirectory git branch --track MOODLE_25_STABLE origin/MOODLE_25_STABLE git checkout MOODLE_25_STABLE php admin/cli/upgrade.php [ENTER] Check version.php in code directory to assure version is now 2.5: fgrep '$release' version.php Check the site.  Go to Notifications and see if there are upgrades available for any add-ons.  If there are, get them via the Moodle UI.   Do a full site backup again (this is fall back position if something goes wrong). If all ok, next step upwards. Same git lines as above, but use 26 in place of 25.   Do the upgrade.php script again. You will be doing these as root user so you might have to change ownerships/permissions right after git acquires the code to appropriate user/group for your dev box setup. There are other scripts in moddlecode/cli/ that might help.  CD into that directory and open them with a text editor to read the comments/get usage info. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upgrade fault sessions table
ResponsesInList.Text: See BOLD Ok, you have a copy ( sql dump,data directory, config.php file)  of your production server on a Linux Ubuntu development box, right?   How are you downloading the sql dump of the production database ? ... raw .sql file or are you tar balling that .sql dump file first, then downloading the tar ball? The production system is on an ubuntu server the trial server is on a windows xampp portable (use this for trying out any major stuff before upgrade. I copy over all the moodledata, moodle and do the sql dump in sql format. I change the config.php to point to the right folders and use the 127.0.0.1 loop back to run the moodle and the server. I then ensure the system is running OK. How are you acquiring the code?   The 'old way' or git ?  This assumes that the development box has the required versions of PHP/ MySQL for version 2.6+ and beyond. I download all the upgrade version and copy the config.php to the new folder and then try the upgrade which checks the system (gives all ok to upgrade) it then falls over when checking / updating the M ySQL. Suggest using git.   For the new code directory one can set the branch to 2.4.x - which means the copy of the site would go through a minor within series upgrade.   Use the edited config.php file for the dev. box. Now before you begin, do you have any add-ons in the currently active 2.4.x on the production server?  How about themes?   If you do, acquire a 2.4.x version of those (the .zip files) and manually unzip them in their appropriate locations on the dev box. Very simple system almost basic theme (built in slightly modified). Almost no addons. Moodle at document root of Ubuntu ... directory is /var/www (correct)?  Note the ownships/permissions on www directory. git clone git://git.moodle.org/moodle.git www cd www git branch -a git branch --track MOODLE_24_STABLE origin/MOODLE_24_STABLE Do the actual upgrade via command line ... cd gitacquiredmoodlecode/admin/cli/  php upgrade.php I will have to set up another ubuntu server to do this (as don't want to interfere with the production site), but will give it a try. This will take a bit of time. Once the that site has been upgraded to 2.4.x highest (and checked out for functionality), step it through an upgrade to 2.5.x, then to 2.6.x, but before you do, make a site backup locally - db dump, archive of code directory is minimal. Site is now functioning 2.4.x - to upgrade it via git: cd moodlecodedirectory git branch --track MOODLE_25_STABLE origin/MOODLE_25_STABLE git checkout MOODLE_25_STABLE php admin/cli/upgrade.php [ENTER] Check version.php in code directory to assure version is now 2.5: fgrep '$release' version.php Check the site.  Go to Notifications and see if there are upgrades available for any add-ons.  If there are, get them via the Moodle UI.   Do a full site backup again (this is fall back position if something goes wrong). If all ok, next step upwards. Same git lines as above, but use 26 in place of 25.   Do the upgrade.php script again. You will be doing these as root user so you might have to change ownerships/permissions right after git acquires the code to appropriate user/group for your dev box setup. There are other scripts in moddlecode/cli/ that might help.  CD into that directory and open them with a text editor to read the comments/get usage info. 'spirit of sharing', Ken Thanks so much for the help, Pete

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upgrade fault sessions table
ResponsesInList.Text: Before doing an update, if your database schema is in doubt do this.... Verify_Database_Schema

ResponsesInList.Title: What's that ?------ Fatal error: Cannot redeclare mimei
ResponsesInList.Text: Fatal error : Cannot redeclare mimeinfo() (previously declared in /home/cpsdvcl/public_html/moodle/lib/filelib.php:3) in /home/cpsdvcl/public_html/moodle/files/mimetypes.php on line 3 It displayed in my web homepage http://cps-vclass.info It didn't show in moodle1.4 , I upgraded from 1.4 to 1.5 today, then " Fatal error : Cannot redeclare ........" What's that ? What should I do ? Thanks a lot.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What's that ?------ Fatal error: Cannot redeclare mimei
ResponsesInList.Text: I had the same problem. Somewhere someone hinted something about the excercise module as the possible cause for this.  On the basis of this I tried three things: a. removing the file mimetypes.php from the /files directory (after all, the standard moodle distribution does not use it)   - this worked, but I'm not sure if this could cause problems with other modules. b. 'hiding' the excercise module  - this worked. c. upgrading the excercise module - this seems to work also. The excercise module is not a part of the standard distribution. So you need to check regularly if there are new versions. I'm no expert, so I do not know for sure which of the 3 suggestions is the best one. The most doubts I have on a). Perhaps someone else has a definitive solution. .feike.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What's that ?------ Fatal error: Cannot redeclare mimei
ResponsesInList.Text: I tried the most conservative of your approaches -- upgrading the "exercise" module. After some heart-stopping sql and php mumbo-jumbo appeared at the top of my screen, everything settled down and the nasty "Fatal error" has gone away. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Slow PDF downloads.
ResponsesInList.Text: I just started a course and have put up a pdf of PowerPoint Slides for the student to print out. The file size is 5.6 mb. I have a limit of 10mb for uploads in the php.ini file and everything uploads fine. Server is a Mac OS X Server (10.2.6) on a 100mb ethernet connection. When a user on a Windows (XP or 2000) client tries to download the file it takes forever (3-5 min on machines on the same speed connection and swtich as the server). Im not sure about dialup, but Im sure it is slow as well. The funny thing is that when a Mac users tries to download it takes about 3 secs (same speed connection and switch as the server). I know that the way Windows and Macs handle downloading pdfs is a little differnt, but there should not be that big of a speed difference. I am going to try and set up a method to download the file outside of moodle tommorrow and change the resource to a weblink to the file instead of the uploaded file option and see how that works. Has anyone seen anything like this before? Anyone have any other suggestions (besides make the file size smaller)? BTW small sized pdfs work fine-its just the big ones that are causing problems. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slow PDF downloads.
ResponsesInList.Text: Check your log files from your web server, and look to see if the browser is trying to download the file twice, each time with a different User Agent string. If it is, then this issue may be related to bug 289. We may need to change the headers sent by moodle in order to work around this bug in IE .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slow PDF downloads.
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, In some times it does download the same file twice, even on a Mac - but it does not always do it. I will check the logs and see if it tried to download it twice in the situation I described earlier. Now that I think about it - when I use Safari on the mac is works correctly, but on IE it downloads twice! Thanks for the quick response.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slow PDF downloads.
ResponsesInList.Text: OK after a quick glance though the logs, it does not appear that the XP machine that I tried this on this morning requested the file twice (using IE 6). However, when I do use IE on the mac it does request the file twice. I dont know if this is realted to the bug you spoke of or not - the double download on the mac may be, but the XP problem who knows. Any other ideas? I will try Netscape on the same XP machine in the morning and try linking the file with a weblink instead a uploaded file and see if that will make a difference. In the mean time if anyone has any other ideas please let me know. I have been considering converting the presentation to a web page, but most students like to print the slides out 6 to a page and that is not an option using the web based method. Thanks. BTW do you see any drawbacks to make the changes in the headers anyway - even if this is not the root cause. May want to do it to avoid any future problems.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slow PDF downloads.
ResponsesInList.Text: http://cvs.sourceforge.net/cgi-bin/viewcvs.cgi/moodle/moodle/file.php?rev=1.9&content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup The headers I'm talking about are sent near the end of the file I've linked to above. The question is: which headers (if any) are causing IE to download the file twice. The second part of the question is: why doesn't IE remember session settings the second time it tries to download the file, which is why the user sees a refresh message (moodle is trying to get the user to log in).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slow PDF downloads.
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok, after a little more work I have helped my situation some. I used Netscape to access the pdf file and it was still very slow. So its not only a IE problem. The logs show that it is not downloading twice. The double download problem only occurs so far on a mac with IE. So what I did was created a download directory in the sites root and have changed the resource from an uploaded file to a webpage and put the link in. The speed is improved, but not what is should be (now around a min. compared to 3-5 min before). Either way I have it set up, the speeds when downloading on a mac are much faster (less that 10 seconds, even when IE downloads twice). So I feel that this is probably not a moodle or a server problem, but a problem with the way XP and 2000 and Acrobat handle pdf files from a web page(which to me has always been a little slow). So Im not sure what else I can do to make the situation any better. Any ideas? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: problems viewing URL
ResponsesInList.Text: I have been trying to set up a weekly page for students with links to websites but no one, even me can see the link unless I turn on the editing. And yes the page is not hidden.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: problems viewing URL
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello and thanks for responding to my request to post here on the forums. I have looked at your screenshots in your Word documents and the reason is that you are using the "show one section per page" course setting. The students can in fact see the URL but they need first to click on the name of the topic which is linked and then it will show the content of that topic. (You can read an explanation of this in this direct link in the documentation here ) However, I suggest that if this is confusing you and your students then you should go to the Course administration block, click Edit settings and then in Course format>Course layout change it to 'show all sections on one page' and then your students will see the URL easily.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: problems viewing URL
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, all worked out now.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to stop email messages in assignment 2
ResponsesInList.Text: hi dear friends actually i want to stop the message from the moodle while any student is uploading his/her assignmnet on turnitin then an automated message on email is received by all the teachers. i want to stop this. how can i stop this? thanks for giving me help

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to stop email messages in assignment 2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Muhammad, TurnItIn notification settings can be found in site administration > plugins > message outputs > default message outputs. You'll want to switch the dropdown in the email column of the row labelled " Turnitin Instructor digital receipt notifications" to "disallowed." It's pretty far down the page, just FYI . Happy Moodling!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I can't get certain plugins to work on MOODLE_28_STABLE when migrating from another instance
ResponsesInList.Text: So, I gave up on using git to manage these modules. I made the directory writable by the webserver (which makes the sysadmin in me shudder) and I was able to download the correct versions of certificate and hsuforum via the plugins page. I downloaded questionnaire as well, but it still has the "Higher version already installed!" message. Anyway, hopefully, that is good enough for our archive. Hopefully I won't run into many issues when I upgrade Moodle for any security releases... I'm going to chalk the higher version stuff up to something Moodlerooms is doing on our production instance. I can't think of any other reason why the MOODLE_28_STABLE branches would have different version numbers than what MR had installed. I wish they had given us a code snapshot as well...

ResponsesInList.Title: Expectations - learning plan - feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, One of our clients have come up with a specific need. They are using Moodle 3.0 to manage offline trainings as well. They would like to receive the preliminary expectations of their sudents before the training, maintain some sort of a lesson plan, and give feedback to their students after the training will be done. Is there a plugin which can manage all of the above? If there isn't, what method would you recommend instead? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Expectations - learning plan - feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: I am not sure if a plug-in is required.  Here is how one could do this. One you open the course, have a "pre-course" survey on Moodle turned on.  In it, use an essay question to ask about student's expectations.  Don't turn on other topics until the course officially begins. There are many ways to post lesson plans.  One can always use the "Page" resource, but there are other ways. When the student completes the course, in the grade book for their final grade, edit the comment field for each student and give them feedback.  Alternatively, email them feedback.

I believe I saw it somewhere where I have to do 8 - 10 clicks to see each one but there has to be a list of them somewhere, no?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for total number of correct answers in a list of students.
ResponsesInList.Text: There are statistic reports in quiz that you can run If you're talking about quiz specifically.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for total number of correct answers in a list of students.
ResponsesInList.Text: Interesting,... And said Statistic Reports are located where? I just don't see them. Yes, I am looking at a quiz. The closest I can find is in Home / ► Fall 2017 / ► F17 Computer Science / ► F17_CS_113_04 / ► Reports / ► Course participation and choose the Week, Activity Module, and Look Back but the numbers under Show Actions :View, Post, and All actions make no sense.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for total number of correct answers in a list of students.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Steve, I sent a reply via direct email with some other info in it. When creating quiz questions, set the Default points for each question to be one. When you create the quiz, set the Maximum grade to be the same as the total number of questions in the quiz, When looking at the Attempts > Grades page, the Grades column will show how many questions each student answered correctly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for total number of correct answers in a list of students.
ResponsesInList.Text: I do not think this is going to work. The students are allowed to take the quiz as often as they want for the week.  The questions are randomly chosen from the bank and some questions are repeated.  They gain one point for each correct answer capped at 100 points.  In case of 20 questions, this would be a minimum of 5 attempts. Each question issues one point for a correct answer. I know I was able to see the total number of correct answers for each attempt in a list organized by student.  I do not seem to see that anymore. All I see is the highest grade for a quiz only because I set that variable as such.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for total number of correct answers in a list of students.
ResponsesInList.Text: In Quiz Administration, you can look at Results.  There are two options you might like: Responses, which shows which answer each person gave for each question (if you do randomizing or random question pools, this might not do what you hope, I think it just shows them in the order of answer and not what question), and Statistics, which tells you general statistics (of 10 students, 70% chose answer A-corrrect, 10% chose answer B-incorrect, 20% chose answer C-incorrect and 0% chose answer D--but not which students). But your post descriptions are not quiz related, those are course reports...what you need is to go to the quiz and look at those results.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for total number of correct answers in a list of students.
ResponsesInList.Text: These percentage values are of no value in a point-earned system. However, parts of these responses combined seem to answer my question. 1 point per question and set the max grade to the number of questions is one.  Looking in the correct location with proper pull down menu option enables (right now I forget which one) is another. There still seems to be a flaw here though.  Sometimes I go in and I see all the attempts in order of student, sometimes the list is not there and all I get in the graph.  This seemed to have happened when I re-ordered the list by last name.  A reset of Moodle seems to have corrected the glitch. Also, in that list of attempts: Some limes are blue highlighted others are not yet there doesn't seem to be a pattern.  It would be nice if the colors sectioned off every other student.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Looking for total number of correct answers in a list of students.
ResponsesInList.Text: In the Grades area (not reports), you can modify the setup and change how grades display if the gradebook is displaying percent (I'm not confident this is the issue).  To do that, you edit the settings for the activity grade or course grade and click See more--then you have a series of options available to you (Real grade, Percentage and letter, etc). I realize this post is lots late but...to find score/points stuff for quiz--go to  the quiz, click Edit Quiz (not quiz settings) and you'll see your max grade and the grade for each question.  You can also go to the Grades area and edit individual activity grades to indicate a grade to pass (you may have to expand it--grade to pass is hidden by default, I think)... this will change course completion from blue check to green check.  Depending on how other things are set up, it may give a red X for non-passing scores. Some of your display issues may be related to theme.  Different themes do different things and you just have to find the one that works best for you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Any word on when 2.0 will be released?
ResponsesInList.Text: Any word on when 2.0 will be released?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Any word on when 2.0 will be released?
ResponsesInList.Text: Not as such, but.. I would suggest you download a copy of it and install it, just not for your production site. Play with it.. get used to it, so that when it does come you will have an idea of what to expect. Given the overall complexity of the project and the enormous technical challenges of the product, what has been achieved is excellent. I suspect this is such a quantum leap in so many areas, I would not be surprised if there is no production version of Moodle 2.0, and Moodle 2.1 becomes the first. You cannot make this kind of change without there being some hitches. Remember that Windows 94 became Windows 95 (and ME became Multiple Errors, but XP did not become Extra Problems, Vista barks and 7.. well the jury is still out...) and they have billions behind them. Martin is doing this on a lot of goodwill and not a lot of cash, so patience is really required. I agree that simmering excitement is hard to contain, and disappointment over unfulfilled expectations will hurt Moodle, but even with what I have seen.. WOW!!! I hope it comes soon, but "soon" may not come that quickly. I am just sorry I cannot offer anything more than a kind word of encouragement to the development team.
